author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1705775494}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
I initially gave this game a bad review, but after forcing myself to play it a bit more, I've changed my mind. This game is pretty fun. I think initially I got stuck on a section with an instant death trap and it made me feel this game was harder than it actually was.  Once I played some more and pushed past that section, I realized its actually a very fun game. Still not a fan of the instant death traps, but they aren't as big a deal as I initially thought.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040173395', 'num_games_owned': 1348, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1701666909}
review:
Really fun game, I can see myself coming back and replaying it from time to time. I really want to try the level editor out more.

I think the game is definitely difficult but also some reviews may be over selling the difficulty a bit. As others have said, this kinda feels like Hotline Miami and Super Meat Boy had a fucked up three way with Doom. Definitely hard, but I never found myself feeling hopeless (at least on the base difficulty).

Loved it and also loved Carrion from the same devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082764480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 428, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1701433048}
review:
BUTCHER is not a particularly bad game but its not great either. It leaves a lot to be desired.
Apart from being a 2D Doom, it has nothing interesting going for it. Gameplay is barebones, weapons aren't creative, levels are uninspired and the artsyle, my god i get that they were going for a unique low res look but it doesn't work at all in a fast paced shooter. It is so hard to detect enemies or projectiles since everything blends in with the environment.
If BUTCHER had something unique going for it maybe it could've been worth your time but since it just feel like the most generic shooter, i highly suggest avoiding it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332849948', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1677246694}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006037807', 'num_games_owned': 1359, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1618166184}
review:
"BUTCHER" - игра, которая, к сожалению, оставляет желать лучшего и сталкивается с несколькими проблемами, которые могут существенно повлиять на общее восприятие игры.
1.	Ограниченный геймплей: Игра предлагает довольно стандартные и монотонные механики геймплея. Отсутствие разнообразия в задачах и ограниченные возможности могут сделать игровой процесс предсказуемым и скучным.
2.	Отсутствие насыщенности сюжета: "BUTCHER" не предлагает глубокого сюжета или хорошо разработанных персонажей. Это может привести к тому, что игроки не будут чувствовать эмоциональную привязанность к миру или событиям, происходящим в нем.
3.	Графический стиль и атмосфера: хотя стилизация "BUTCHER" может нравиться определенной аудитории, она может оказаться слишком мрачной и угнетающей для некоторых игроков. Отсутствие визуального разнообразия может утомить на протяжении длительной игры.
4.	Уровни могут быть слишком сложными: Отсутствие баланса в сложности уровней может привести к чрезмерным вызовам для большинства игроков. Это может создать чувство фрустрации и снизить удовлетворение от прохождения игры.
5.	Ограниченные возможности настройки: Игра предоставляет ограниченные возможности настройки, что может оказаться проблемой для игроков, привыкших к более гибким настройкам в других играх.
6.	Недостаточная оптимизация: встречаются проблемы с оптимизацией, которые могут вызывать проседания в производительности и другие технические трудности, что оставляет негативное впечатление от технической стороны игры.
В общем, "BUTCHER" может подойти для тех, кто ищет экстремальные вызовы в геймплейе и предпочитает мрачные стилизованные игры, но она скорее всего не будет всем по вкусу из-за своих ограниченных механик и других недостатков.

author: {'steamid': '76561198413758298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1694709283}
review:
Игра пройдена на предпоследнем уровне сложности (а это в свою очередь 100 хп без возможности похилиться и без брони вообще) и можно сказать следующее - не, ребята, это хуета полнейшая, а не хардкор. В игре крайне мало оружия и вы практически ничего не будете использовать кроме дробовика и автомата (огнемет был бы имбой если бы не дамажила выпущенная собственная струя пламени, а потеря хп таким образом на Hardest гарантированно позволяет врагам ваншотнуть следующим выстрелом). Гранатомёт просто бесполезный мусор, дак ещё и с крайне малым максимальным боезапасом всего в 10 ГРАНАТ. Дробовик вообще работает через жопу - вы можете запросто ваншотнуть с далека, а можете в упор ошеломить врага или вовсе не попадать, т.к. ствол проходит сквозь него (в то время как по вам попадают как нехуй делать) и лишь автомат в этом говне работает так, как надо, но увы, патроны тратятся очень быстро. Сами уровни начиная с джунглей мало того, что полнейшая залупа в плане расстановки врагов, так ещё и разрабы не брезгуют время от времени злоупотреблять бэктрекингом и заставляют вас бегать по повторным локациям (привет вышеупомянутые джунгли). А последние уровни перед финальным боссом и вовсе показывают всю творческую импотенцию разрабов этой говноигры. Мало того, что врагов расставлено дохуя и вынуждают вас юзать этот паршивый, неудобный рейлган, так он ещё и умудряется простреливать сквозь хитбкосы летающих врагов с крутящимися пилами.  Ну а финальный босс вообще непроходим, если у вас нет рейлгана, ибо вышеупомянутый гранатомёт патроны, к которому вам выдают для битвы с ним, посос во всех отношениях, а с другого вооружения урон просто не будет. -12 посланных нахуй разрабов средним пальцем из 10.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3035604543

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3232, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1688249648}
review:
"BUTCHER" türünde kült bir klasik olarak hizmet veren, yoğun oyun hayranlarına kana bulanmış bir aşk mektubu sunan hızlı tempolu bir 2D nişancı oyunudur. Lav çukurlarında cesetlerden kurtulmayı ve duvarlara kan sıçratmayı içeren bir oyunu takdir ediyorsanız, "BUTCHER" sizin için bir oyun olabilir.

Temel Özellikler:

    Acımasız Zorluk: En kolay mod bile "HARD"! "BUTCHER" cezalandırıcı zorluğu ve hızlı aksiyonuyla bilinir.

    2D Nişancı: Oyun, insanlığın son kalıntılarını yok etmek için programlanmış bir cyborg olarak oynarken acımasız ve yoğun bir deneyim sağlayan 2D bir nişancı oyunudur.

    Her Şeyi Yok Edin: "BUTCHER "daki tek amacınız hareket eden her şeyi yok etmektir. Elektrikli testere, pompalı tüfek ve el bombalarından oluşan silahınızı kuşanın ve yeraltı sığınaklarında, kıyamet sonrası şehirlerde ve ormanlarda yolunuzu açın.

    Yaratıcı Eliminasyon: Yıkımınızda yaratıcılığı tercih ediyorsanız, kancalar, lav çukurları, testereler veya diğer ölümcül çevresel tehlikeleri kullanarak düşmanlarınızın acısını sona erdirmenin sayısız yolunu bulabilirsiniz. Hiçbir ölüm aynı olmayacak.

    Hardcore Oyunculara Bir Aşk Mektubu: "BUTCHER" zorlu oynanışı, ürkütücü mizahı ve kan dolu aksiyonu takdir eden oyunculara hitap ediyor. Becerilerinizi test etmek ve yoğun ve affetmeyen bir deneyim sunmak için tasarlanmıştır.

Aşırı şiddet ve acımasız zorluğa eğilimli, zorlu, hızlı tempolu 2D nişancı oyunlarının hayranıysanız, "BUTCHER" tam size göre olabilecek benzersiz ve içgüdüsel bir oyun deneyimi sunuyor.

review:
VERY good game. To me it feels like a mix of classic DOOM and Carrion. The art is great, and the music is really fitting. I can't believe they made a game with such a small resolution so badass feeling.

The difficulty curve was very fair in my opinion, and the visual effects when killing enemies was really satisfying. The only thing I wasn't a huge fan of is how some of your weapons can damage yourself (especially the flamethrower), but I'll admit it added extra depth to the gameplay!

9/10

review:
I have no idea why but the game and its controls really do not seem to work properly on the Steam Deck which is kinda weird. And yes, I know you have to change to controller in the settings. For some reason the game does not detect certain buttons like the Dpad and I couldnt progress through the tutorial. 

This game worked way better on the Nintendo Switch. I guess the PC version is really only made for Keyboard and Mouse and its not optimized for the Steam Deck. Bit of a bummer since this game would be perfect for the Steam Deck.

author: {'steamid': '76561199138140583', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1710223898}
review:
I wish I enjoyed this game. I really do. It looks cool and edgy, it's very well optimized, as a premise it should be something I enjoy. But unfortunately this is a "right ingredients, terrible cook" situation.

Imagine if you took all the cheapest, most annoying elements from any game it takes inspiration from or is compared to, and make it all even worse somehow with a lack of checkpoints, forcing you to restart an entire level upon dying. But it's fine, right? It's all under the "THIS IS A REAL MAN'S GAME, WE'RE SO EDGY AND COOL" mask that it pathetically tries to wear to hide its disgusting, terrible truth.

The weapons of this game are pretty standard, perhaps a bit underwhelming at times, especially the Assault Rifle and a strangely pointless kick. The movement is standard too, it's a bit floaty when you're midair but other than that it's fine.

The real problems start with the enemies and level design. The lower tier enemies use cheap projectiles that sometimes takes half your health or more, and sometimes just a little bit (Cause, y'know, game design!). The higher tier ones have a different problem where they have a really strange out of place health bar, have an even cheaper attack (Mainly referring to the saw guys, the rocket dudes are fine), and also just take 0 damage sometimes? It's weird.

The levels are mostly very linear and to the point, but unfortunately suffer from the cheap enemies and lack of proper checkpoints. Another problem I have with the levels too is that they don't really stand out all that well, they sort of all mesh together into one blob. Doesn't help that grey enemies are very hard to notice on the grey background, which is a problem when most of them can instakill you.

I didn't play this game to hate on it. It actually started out pretty promisingly! With its toned down difficulty you can appreciate the positives of this game significantly more. But unfortunately, it just crashed and burned for me. A shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561199518594705', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1708894288}
review:
Nunca fui fã de doom, ou de fps do ne geral, então não achei que fosse gostar tanto desse jogo aqui, comprei porque tava por 3,99 reais (no caso 4 reais basicamente kkkkkk) e porque não tinha nada pra comprar, mas meu deus, esse jogo é maravilhoso.

gameplay: parece katana zero, só que com armas, muito satisfatório e gostozinho, fluido mesmo no meu notebook de 4 gb ram kkkkkkk.

lore: o jogo começa com um bocado de coisas que nem você (provavelmente robôs) naquelas maquina lá como se tivesse sendo produzido muito, depois tem um tutorialzinho e vai lá destruir a humanidade.

tá tá eu odeio analisar jogos assim por topicos, no geral BUTCHER é um jogo muito foda pra quem quer passar o tempo e se desafiar, sla, é divertido que só o carai.

"se for jogar não gaste toda a sua munição quando terminar uma fase pra comemorar, porque na proxima, a sua munição vai ta do mesmo jeito da desgraça passada, tem jeitos melhores de comemorar, tipo se masturbar pros cadàveres  de seus inimigos (eu falei que esse jogo era maravilhoso).

BUTCHER: the easiest mode is "hard"
e sim o meu tempo de jogo foi proposital.

review: Shooter 2D desafador. O jogo te prende em arenas e só te deixa seguir depois de matar todos os inimigos, me lembrou bastante DOOM de 2016. As armas e inimigos são bem variados e como eu já disse antes o jogo é bem desafiador kk mas não chega a ser injusto, não tem save dentro das missões mas pra compensar elas são bem curtinhas e o jogo acaba bem na hora que deveria. O único problema que eu tive nesse jogo foram algumas questões de visibilidade, é tudo muito pequeno na tela e as falta de variedade na paleta de cores também não ajuda muito, com certeza isso me rendeu algumas mortes indesejadas. Enfim, super divertido o jogo. Recomendo!

sice z hry toho veľa odohratého nemám

hra je strašne jedinečná

review:
Jogo desafiador mas nada impossível, decorando os movimentos dos inimigos fica fácil o problema é se vc ficar em um canto cercado.
Joguei com teclado e mouse a fase 1 e não passei porque tinha um auto ain lockado em todos e varios bug de pulo e troca de arma, optei pelo controle que não teve bug até o boss final que ficou no auto ain de novo e era impossivel acerta os primeiros 6 hits necessários pra passar sem sufoco. Poderia ser fácil menos de 2h30 de gameplay mas os bugs me prenderam em fases que eu repeti até 6x a mesma.
Acho que paguei 5 na promo e valeu a pena fora disso é loucura.

author: {'steamid': '76561198804587288', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1693517027}
review:
[h1]Butcher.[/h1]

Clair, direct et simple. On ne passe pas par 4 chemins, [b]buter[/b] les restes de l'humanité d'une violence extrême et sans retenue : innocents, soldats et autres vivants doivent y passer. Tuer des trucs par centaines de milliers et secouer son zigmao de métal, voilà ce qu'il nous est proposé.

Butcher s'inspire de la célèbre saga [i]Terminator[/i], sous forme de jeu de plateforme 2D et jeu de tir, le tout dans un univers futuriste industriel dystopique décomplexé. 

Le jeu se veut difficile, et certains passages étaient plus hardcores que d'autres, une difficulté mal géré? moi, incapable de jouer correctement? un peu des deux? Je ne sais pas, mais le jeu est bon : musiques, direction artistique, pixels, ambiance très métalleuse... bref j'ai aimé.

N.B. : Et très sobrement, je dirais : "[i][b]Cœur de pierre, cul de fer.[/b][/i]"

author: {'steamid': '76561197971885969', 'num_games_owned': 914, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1616549152}
review:
I am a 48 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you were supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he helped me. Loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
Thank you <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198210570531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1676406157}
review: Quake/Doom ama 2d. Karanlık uzay atmosferine sahip, kanlı vahşetli, seviye seviye ilerlediğimiz ve içinde platform ögeleri de bulunan zor bir aksiyon oyunu Butcher. Oyunda öyle hikaye falan yok. Bir robotuz ve tek derdimiz insan kesmek. Piksel ve minimalistik grafiklerine takılmayın, her bir vuruşunuzla birilerini parçaladığınızı oyun size gayet güzel hissettiriyor. Müzikler ve ses efektleri de o gergin, vahşi ve aksiyon tempolu atmosferi gayet güzel destekliyor. Oyunu beğendim ama sabır seviyesi yüksek insanların almasını, alacaklarsa da indirimde almalarını tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024340430', 'num_games_owned': 2082, 'num_reviews': 7498, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1672595284}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198091792984', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1670104272}
review:
DOOM versão Mario Bros, só isso.

Sim, o jogo é leve que roda no seu microondas. E sim o jogo é difícil, porém pode se tornar fácil em computadores que pode dar baixo framerate, quanto menos framerate menos lento jogo fica e isso facilita TUDO (ó o pobre).

Butcher é um jogo simples, não tem história mas a linguagem visual que apresenta no game demonstra dizer o suficiente, o jogo tem referências a game e filme. De trilha sonora ele não varia muito, mas é boa de ouvir se não ficar horas jogando (pois pode enjoar). Também não é difícil de usar os controles. Simplesmente vai, atira e sobreviva.

O jogo pode variar bastante se usar modo de editor, neste caso fica ao seu critério. E sim ele roda muito bem tanto no Win quanto no Linux (nativamente, sem proton). Os desenvolvedores merecem o respeito pelo trabalho.

No mais, compre na promoção.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1574031257}
review:
Rip and Tear, Now in 2D.

Story:

You play as a machine designed to kill. Your ship docks at a station and you find a bunch of portals there, inside you find a bunch of humans that you have to destroy. In reality there's no story in this game, it just drops you into the chaos and lets you figure stuff out yourself, I don't think there's even any dialogue or story explanation whatsoever, so I might be talking out of my ass. 

Graphics:

Visually Butcher is simplistic, but one thing it has in droves is blood and guts. Visually it's very much inspired by the original DOOM, but a lot darker in tone. Levels look like an industrial nightmare and once you drop by and start unloading your weapons into people, they wind up being drenched in blood, it really looks awesome in action. 

I will say the only minor negative I can give the art design is that with a lot of the insanely hectic action, keeping track of your character during fights is a bit of a challenge, especially during boss fights. It's not that big of a problem when you really focus, but it still got me killed a few times. 

Audio:

The audio design is top notch across the board. First of all I have to say the music is great and really adds to the hectic nature of the game. You feel like a total badass, just shredding through enemies, while metal blasts in your ears, it's just wickedly awesome.

The other sound effects are also great, weapons sound meaty, something I didn't expect considering how the game looks and I live by the "don't judge a book by it's cover mantra". I especially loved using the shotgun and that one good shot splatters a person into meaty chunks, it's really satisfying. 

Gameplay:

Butcher is basically is DOOM converted into a side scroller. The gist and the gameplay is pretty much the same, but now it's now on a 2D plain. You walk around, look for secrets, keycards that unlock new areas (more like switches) and of course blast everything that moves in the face. 

The shooting feels incredibly fluid and fun and I think the combat is definitely incredibly addictive and I had tons of fun fighting enemies and bosses, however the exploration part I wasn't particularly fond off. Now don't get me wrong, the level design for the most part is very good and allows for a good combat flow, but sometimes the level design takes a hit and certain areas are just not fun to go through, especially in the jungle portion of the game. 

Also let's cover the difficulty. As soon as you open up the game it tells you right away "The easiest mode is hard" and yeah the game is pretty damn difficult. A few attacks will wipe the floor with you and honestly some areas are just so brutally hard I wound up rage quitting, but as soon as I set the game aside, I'd want to jump back in and kick that levels ass and once I got through the final boss it felt like an actual accomplishment. I believe there is a casual mode if you want to experience it without the crushing difficulty, but I believe there is a catch for it. 

Verdict:

Butcher is a really fun and addictive take on the DOOM formula, it's fast, it's brutal and of course most importantly it's fun. If you like that type of shooter, then you owe yourself to play Butcher, it will be a great 3 hours to go through it's campaign. So go and rip and tear some humans. 

Final Rating:
9/10

Pros:
+ Great audio design
+ Addictive gameplay
+ Visually pretty good
+ Soundtrack kicks ass

Cons:
- Keeping track of your character through some fights is tough
- Level design has some low points 

If you liked this review please consider joining https://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog and https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews

author: {'steamid': '76561197988468467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1666156915}
review: "hard is the easiest difficulty" or some SH*t like that. The difficulty in this game is artificial. The art style makes it very difficult to tell if an enemy has been killed and sometimes the fallen enemies are still moving, so you decide to throw more precious ammo at them. Also the enemies are very small. Everything is in fact very small so its extremely difficult to tell whats going on and aim at anything. The devs just don't know how to make an actual challenge versus making something extremely difficult. The idea is to make the challenge fun to take on and get past, and this fails on both counts. Maybe it's fun for people who just like to aim at little fast-moving targets. I'd have returned it if i wasn't past the limit, but here we are...

author: {'steamid': '76561198087437757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1665508475}
review:
Не зашло. Имело все шансы затянуть в хороший, аркадный боевик, но нет. Причины следующие:
1. Максимально репетативный геймплей. Вы, повторяете одни и те же действия, продвигаясь по уровню, пока не умрете, или не пройдете уровень. От вас не требуется никаких навыков. Вы просто запоминаете места спавна врагов и отрабатываете по ним едва те появляются, из-за чего аркадшый экшен становится СКУЧНЫМ. Вкусовщина, но я не любитель подобного
2. Абсолютно ужасный оружейный баланс. У вас есть начальный дробовик - все. Больше вам ничего и никогда в этой жизни не потребуется. Оружие на все случаи жизни и ничего, кроме малого боезапаса(Да и то не всегда), не побудит вас его сменить. 
3. Графика и дизайн уровней. Я НЕ противник пикселей, но тут уж слишком с ними переборщили, из-за чего в процессе боя, из-за общей цветовой гаммы и огромного количества разлетающихся частиц, вы легко можете проморгать недобитка, который одним выстрелом отправит вас проходить уровень сначала. А это, при местной системе урона, будет происходить часто.
С самими уровнями проблема в том, что сделаны они стильно и красиво с точки зрения эстетической, но не играбельной. Если вы не потратите время на изучение уровня и/или на ломание глаз - вы едва-ли в горючке боя с ходу поймете какие платформы простреливаются, а какие нет, ибо визуально все сливается.

Положительно могу выделить лишь звуковое сопровождение. Крики сделаны шикарно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047474483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1595536706}
review:
"Butcher" is a grim, tough-as-nails 2D-sidescrolling twin-stick-shooter, where you play as a killer-machine from space on the mission to eradicate all human life on earth. It definetly has some "Terminator"-Vibes (the ending is referring to it quite obviously), but still manages to create a more rustier, (literally) darker and grittier tone. The violence is over the top with a moaning sound palette and blood and guts spilling and dangling all over the place, but this "artistic" choice wont distract you from the fact that the standard difficulty-setting is set on "hardcore". While this pixelated dystopia is rendered quite well, I personally find the sprites too small and to low-res, but this is just personal taste.

Check this out, if you thrive in an action-paced and unrelenting experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198107085835', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1665270927}
review:
The game sells on being hard, and it is.

Some complain about the hard being annoying or obnoxious, but that's literally what Butcher was going for in the first place. The rage-inducing design is intentional. Being annoyingly hard is literally the whole point of Butcher's existence as a videogame, and it accomplishes that with no questions.

It's also perfect if you ever have that one annoying friend that complains about games being too easy. Just get him a copy of Butcher while it's on sale, then in the steam gift screen, tell your friend to beat it. When he does, tell him to do it again on the harder settings.
If your friend claims he did, check his steam achievements before calling him out like the liar he (probably) is.

I actually do have friends that have beaten this game on regular-Hard and I'm on the verge of beating it myself.
It's possible to beat the game. It's just that Butcher is meticulously cruel in how it's difficulty works.

Some crazy people actually did beat this game on it's hardest settings, but unless you unironically pay rent from a psycho ward, I don't advise sacrificing your sanity.

Yea, that's it. I don't know what else to even say.

Game's hard. It tells you it's hard. If you don't believe that it's hard, then that's your hubris not mine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010315744', 'num_games_owned': 1309, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1653171153}
review:
Seems like it would be pretty fun, except the humans have pinpoint accuracy while you do not, even though you are essentially a T-800. 

Also there's no option to turn off screenshake which doesn't help either.

author: {'steamid': '76561199161026013', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1703202853}
review: По началу я думал,что у меня вытекут глаза. Но потом, под очаровательную индустриальную музыку и в ритме загнанной крысы, я вовлекся в этот бесконечный,но очень увлекательный симбиоз пиксильного платформера и мясного шутана. Скорости запредельные. Практически полное отсутствие каких либо изысканий. Главное реакция. Враги буквально слетаются как мухи на... На что-то тёплое. И сразу начинают палить в вас выкрикивая обидные обзывания:) Застыл на месте и вот ты уже остывающее по стенам ничто. Если и можно было перенести драйв скоростных 3D шутанов в пиксельный плоский мир,то разработчикам данной игры это удалось в полной мере.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024138776', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 429, 'playtime_forever': 1879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1708336866}
review:
Wymagająca strzelanka platformowa, w której wcielamy się w rolę robota którego zadaniem jest wyeliminowanie resztek ludzkości w futurystycznym świecie. Zwiedzamy tutaj ludzkie placówki rozsiane po różnych planetach, aby je oczyścić z ludzkiej zarazy.

Gra składa się z krótkich etapów, w których musimy zabić wszystkich przeciwników. Etapy te są zwykle podzielone na niewielkie areny, do których falami teleportują się kolejni przeciwnicy. Jeśli zginiemy, musimy zaczynać cały etap od nowa - nie ma tutaj opcji zapisu stanu rozgrywki. A dzieje się to całkiem często, gdyż przeciętne trafienie zabiera nam około połowę życia, a przeciwnicy otwierają do nas ogień natychmiast po wejściu w ich pole widzenia. Dużą rolę odgrywa więc tutaj zapamiętywanie pozycji przeciwników oraz odpowiednie planowanie działań. Należy zaznaczyć, że nawet na najprostszym z czterech poziomów trudności gra jest całkiem trudna, a im dalej w las, tym mniej punktów życia i apteczek leczących. Apteczki te, wraz z amunicją, teleportują się razem z przeciwnikami na areny, a także są pozostawiane przez martwych przeciwników. Zebranie ich nie jest jednak takie proste, gdyż znikają dosyć szybko, a próba ich zdobycia zwykle wystawia nas na ogień jeszcze żyjących przeciwników.

Przejdźmy do tego, jakie zabawki ta gra nam oferuje. A jest to kilka różnych broni, które stopniowo zdobywamy w trakcie kampanii. Z początku są to dosyć podstawowe bronie, jak piła łańcuchowa, strzelba, karabin czy miotacz ognia. Jednak w ostatnich etapach rozgrywki zdobywamy granatnik oraz działo elektromagnetyczne. Są one całkiem przydatne, jako że w późniejszej części gry pojawiają się opancerzeni przeciwnicy, którzy nie giną od jednego trafienia. Oprócz standardowych przeciwników wyposażonych w strzelby czy karabiny, znajdziemy takich, którzy szarżują na nas bronią białą czy unikają trafienia dzięki plecakowi odrzutowemu. Wszyscy oni jednak giną od jednego trafienia. Mocniejsi przeciwnicy potrafią strzelać w nas piłami tarczowymi czy rakietami samonaprowadzającymi.

Gra oferuje krwawą, pixelartową grafikę, która jest dosyć czytelna. Dla wielbicieli gore jest tu nawet fizyka krwi oraz wnętrzności zabijanych przeciwników. A do tego mroczna i ciężka muzyka, dzięki której możemy poczuć się jak mechaniczny zabójca.

Podsumowując, jest to świetna produkcja dla fanów wymagających produkcji, w której musimy opanować do perfekcji pozycje przeciwników i mieć niezły refleks. Wysoki poziom trudności sprawia, że gra dostarcza sporego zastrzyku adrenaliny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979502979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1711677802}
review:
Immensely fun game, ridiculously gory and violent. Feels like what you'd get if you threw Soldat and Brutal Doom in a blender. The gameplay is fast-paced and satisfying, thanks in part to the great visual and auditory feedback when shooting enemies, with blood, guts and gibs splattering every which way and painting the walls, floors and ceilings red, all the while hearing their pain grunts and screams layering over the loud gunfire and the thumping beat of the soundtrack. 
Blasting tiny pixel men apart never gets old in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992179075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1646933666}
review:
"I need your clothes, your boots, your motorcycle, and all your internal organs so I can do some redecorating around here."

If you're an Old Biddy Millennial like me you might recall late last century back in '97 firing up your state-of-the-art 75mhz Pentium PC to play a little adrenaline-saturated title called "Abuse." I'd call BUTCHER a spiritual successor to Abuse in terms of gameplay, setting, and aesthetics, but with the violence cranked up to Doomslayer levels and, crucially, instead of trying to save humanity from being exterminated you're pretty much a T-800 gone Full Skynet and released upon the last bastion of disgusting meatbag holdouts in order to finish off Terminatoring every last one. 

The pixel art is as low-fidelity as it can be while still being visually legible, with some options for classic CRT visuals for that nostalgic kick. The art style itself is gritty, industrial sci-fi in the vein of Aliens series, some WH40K Mechanicus-style superstructures, and a nice heaping dose of Event Horizon poured thickly over the top. The music is as industrial as the imagery, its grinding hammering beats the perfect companion to the gut-shaking weapons fire, explosions, and desperate screams of the horrified humans who aren't shy about letting everyone know how getting turned into salsa by a vicious murder-machine as much a Real Fucking Bad Time as it looks. L

The controls are slick, the action fast, the combat brutal & merciless, but I admit I do feel pity for whatever hell-roomba is assigned to scrape the walls clean of the thick human paste that now coats everything. There are no checkpoints and making a mistake can easily smash your murder-machine to bits, and while the lack of any mid-level checkpoints  might seem like an oversight the levels are only minutes long so its well-balanced and helps a lot to keeps the tension tight without becoming frustrating. This is the kind of game you might find in an arcade and have the time of your life playing before you realize the machine just ate 40 bucks of your cash in arcade tokens. 

There's a free easy mode DLC which drastically changes the flow and removes much of the intensity of the gameplay (and the intensity is pretty core to the experience), so much so that the devs made it a separate download to encourage players to give the regular difficulties a decent shot. I look at it as an accessibility feature, it should make the game enjoyable and playable for players who would otherwise struggle with normal mode for reasons of disability  or lack of experience with fast, high-difficulty, old-school style shoot-em-ups.

tl;dr: If you thought Skynet wasn't nearly *just plain mean enough* to humanity, this is just the robot apocalypse simulator for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198963928525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1697907410}
review:
АХАХАХАХАХХАХАХАХАХА Вас смущает типо пиксельное мыло, у вас болят глаза и голова,ну вы инвалиды, хочу добавить вас в эту прекрасную игру, как рядовых противников, и насмехаться над вашими расчленёнными телами страдающих от боли.Вы попались на байт 21 века.
Игра сама по себе хорошая, даёт челлендж, особо в поисках секретов.
AHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA You are confused by a kind of pixel soap, your eyes and head hurt, well, you are disabled, I want to add you to this wonderful game as ordinary opponents, and mock your dismembered bodies suffering from pain.You have fallen for the byte of the 21st century.
The game itself is good, it gives a challenge, especially in search of secrets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198999181480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1644694070}
review: Przyjemne mordowanko. Dizajnem nie powala, pixelartowe postacie są dość brzydkie/nieczytelne, ale taki chyba był zamysł twórców. Tak czy inaczej gameplay zarąbisty. Panuje tutaj sieczka aż miło, wrogowie po zestrzeleniu ich z shotguna rozpaćkują się na wszystkie strony. Polecam każdemu kto lubi lubi Dooma, Metal Sluga czy Hotline Miami.

author: {'steamid': '76561199209824637', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1643558111}
review:
BUTCHER is a challenging, fast-paced, Ultraviolent, and HyperGore-ish Action Platformer that will resemble the Golden era of First Doom and Quake. As the game introduces itself, the easiest difficulty in BUTCHER is Hard! Levels are pretty short and well designed to deliver exciting gameplay to its fullest. Unlike the Gore art elements, the characters are not so detailed, but it won't affect the joy of killing them at all. Turning enemies to Ketchup with a close Shotgun blast or getting the long shot and watching the top half of their bodies spreading around the platforms while watching the blood leaking from top to the ground is an absolute joy. Mix this with a heavy atmospheric soundtrack that will create harmony with the screams of the fallen enemies.

Dodging bullets by running and jumping around the platforms will make our blood pressure goes skyrocket and nothing beats switching in our weapons arsenal in the middle of this mess and getting revenge from the enemies. In the end, If you are not in the mood for the challenging gameplay, frustration, and do it again and again, you can add the casual difficulty with a free DLC from the BUTCHER steam page and purely
enjoy the game. 

Happy Gaming

author: {'steamid': '76561198408721619', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1692902227}
review: Gra jest kurewsko trudna ale bardzo satysfakcjonująca i wciągająca. Pixel artowa grafika wygląda świetnie, poziomy są różnorodne, mamy szeroki arsenał ciekawych i potężnych broni, atmosfera jest gęsta a ambientowy soundtrack ją tylko potęguje. Świetny i krwawy niszowy tytuł który ciepło polecę każdemu. Ocena 9/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198813683572', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1641371696}
review:
Очень крутая и кровавая игра.Правила тут как в почти любой стрелялке 90x...убивать убивать убивать
Очень круто играть за робота который подумал,а почему бы не уничтожить всех людишек.Вообщем этакий крутой терминатор который убивает все что видит.
Особенно круто как тут скулят враги.Весь экран превращается в кашу из-за того,что слишком много кетчупа,ибо врагов тут очень много и убить могут очень быстро,если стоять на месте.
Вообщем фанатам Hotline Miami,точно зайдет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016686103', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1641168451}
review:
All the gore and violence seems so pointless...
Like, would it kill you to have 30 seconds worth of story at the beginning?

"You're a robot, kill humans"
Great. How are there robots? Why do I run around killing everyone?
The graphics and setting of the game are amazing but the story is so stupid and overdone that I don't have interest in playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008952110', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1636829263}
review:
Предпоследний уровень прошел с попытки эдак 40+, в последний раз его включал с мыслью [i]"так, все, я или прохожу эту eбoтню, или удаляю все к хeрaм".[/i] Прошел на реактивной тяге, и выяснилось что впереди еще последний босс.
Разбил об него лицо несколько раз, отложил до следующего вечера. Закурил бы, если бы было чего курить.
Бесценно.

Шутер с видом сбоку, в котором очень легко подохнуть: урона вносят много, быстро и довольно резко.
Мы - киборг, которого закоротило где-то на конвейере, и он радостно понесся уничтожать жалкие остатки человечества на изгаженной Земле. Сюжета тут в сущности почти нет, все больше про эстетику кровищи-грязищи посреди ржавых железок.
Главная фишка - самый низкий уровень сложности это "hard". Первые уровней 8 не особо чувствуется, дохнешь скорее от непривычки и собственной глупости, но дальше начинает медленно накручиваться жесткач, который к последнему этапу и боссу достигает высшей точки.
Причем все по-честному, нет ощущения произвола охрeнeвшего геймдизайнера или что вы дохнете от рандома. Абсолютно всю жесть в какой-то момент учишься вывозить (да, даже 7 летающих мужиков с пилами за раз =_=), если нет привычки от смерти в игре сходу переворачивать стол и разбивать монитор, да и при помощи спидранерских приемчиков вроде [strike]рокет[/strike] гранатджампа можно сокращать дорогу.

Я пожалуюсь всего на пару вещей:
1. Запас патронов в карманах очень маленький - под конец иногда кончается в пределах комнаты-другой. Но это не проблема, проблема - переключение c опустошенного оружия: можно настроить только или на малость неадекватную автоматику (сбрасывает на шотган, вторую пушку =_=), или отключить, и время от времени оказываться в комнате полной врагов с пустым магазином и судорожно переключаться на что придется.
На некоторых уровнях из Last city я прям чувствовал, что оба варианта меня одинаково не устраивают и отвлекают в самый неподходящий момент.
2. Весь Last city, в сущности, не сильно сложнее предыдущих уровней, однако там больше комнат. Отчего когда дохнешь, проходить заново через весь уровень и снова и снова отработанными движениями преодолевать достаточно простые и предсказуемые вещи по дороге к реально жестким моментам начинает сильно утомлять; а дохнуть приходится чаще всего именно на этом этапе. =_=

В целом - очень хорошая и относительно быстрая мелкая игра для тех, кто любит страдать и чувствовать, как раскаленный git gud течет по венам после очередного залпа дробовика в лицо.
Не все оценят, и это норма. Но мне понравилось.

P.S. Пробовал на свиче в самый первый раз, мне тогда показалось что на контроллере совсем неудобно. Но то мои личные впечатления.

Моар обзоров видеоигр: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31963048/

Мой канал в телеге с обзорами других вещей: https://t.me/desertwitch

author: {'steamid': '76561198027223922', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4571, 'last_played': 1630927222}
review:
TL;DR - Game has issues with identity, clarity, difficulty, and controller being superior to M&K. Fun, but anything past “hard” stops being fun and starts being tedious. Pick up on steep sale and do not go for all achievements

This “Yes” recommendation comes with some major reservations, sadly, so let's get into it. 

I'm not going to focus on the positives and instead talk about my grievances with this game.

Design - Does this want to be a run and gun speed game or a slow paced tactical shooter? I can’t tell and neither can the game. You are INCREDIBLY fragile. on the highest difficulty there are no checkpoints and you basically get one shot by everything, so you should stay back and shoot right? Nope! You have VERY limited ammo reserves and past midscreen, the accuracy and damage of most weapons drops off SIGNIFICANTLY. In arena fights, foes are spawned around you in 360 degrees, all shooting at you with aimbot precision. Oh, and if you thought this was like Super Meat Boy, the arena fight enemies are spawned in a random order so no memorizing them!


Small Pixel Characters - I love the pixel art but following the action is a NIGHTMARE sometimes. I’ve died so many times when something spawns behind a corpse or just barely on screen that this is a HUGE point of complaint. Enemies NEED to stand out more.


Uneven difficulty - The final boss is a joke, the actual final boss of this game is Mission 5 area 3, the nightclub. There is VERY little cover, and what feels like 10 waves of enemies without a respite. If the RNG spawns decide to spawn everything on your side of the club, you will quickly get overwhelmed.


Aim Assist - Controllers get lock on so they are actually at a significant advantage over mouse and keyboard, with no way to turn on any sort of aim assist on for the mouse, putting that control method at a disadvantage.


It’s hard to feel like the “Butcher” a hard core killer of humanity when you’re the squishiest thing in the game. I enjoyed my time with it, but as the difficulty goes up, the game gets less fun and starts being more about playing like a coward.

To BUTCHER I say: No, F#@$ You Ultimately.

review: I mean the style of the game is a tried and true good one however the way it's executed in Butcher just falls short. It feels more like an arena shooter than an actual continuous game. You essentially go from room to room (or arena from arena) where you need to activate something to continue progressing. Everytime you activate enemies begin spawning around the room before you can continue. Hence why this is essentially just an arena simulator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123172173', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1626966209}
review:
Итак, сегодня у нас игра - Butcher, или когда твой робот-пылесос переключился на режим "насилие".
Буду честен, писать развернутый разбор на игру, в которой провел 20 минут - неправильно, поэтому опишу то, что успел лицезреть.

Если кратко: Слишком большие пиксели, слишком маленькие человечки, все сливается в одну кашу и спецэффектов и мыла - после 10 мин игры заболели глаза и голова. Играть лично для меня оказалось не возможно. 
При этом, вышеописанное буквально контрастирует с отличным музыкальным сопровождением и общей динамикой на экране (это я усмотрел под "допингом", т.е. пока действовали капли от раздражения и боли в глазах).
Есть еще редактор уровней, но копаться в нем у меня желания не возникло. 

Что по итогу имеем: Bucther - самый харизматичный персонаж сериала, мотивация которого не "шита белыми нитками", который стремиться убивать супов не просто ради забавы, а .... упс, чутка не то))

BUTCHER - добротный экшен с хорошей музыкой, который может бросить вызов бывалым тру-про-скейл геймерам. Но из-за спорного pixelart дизайна уровней и персонажей, ярких спецэффектов и общей динамики игры раскрыть его для себя сможет не каждый. 
Вернее раскрыть сможет не только лишь каждый, мало кто сможет это сделать... (О_о)

author: {'steamid': '76561198079187939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1628096884}
review:
Dankzij de casual mode is deze game te spelen, maar dit wil niet zeggen dat het dan poepsimpel is want in de latere levels volgt meerdere keren onvermijdelijk de dood!
De latere levels zijn voorzien van bewegende en verpletterende muren en daar helpt dat extra armor en health niet! Maar daar is het een kwestie van de stappen te onthouden en dan kom je er wel.

De graphics zijn heerlijk bloederig van uiteenspattende lichamen en druipend bloed overal! Dankzij de prachtige pixel look maakt het dit spel zeer spectaculair. Op de achtergronden zie je allerhande al dan niet draaiende machinerie en erg mooie lichteffecten.
De soundtrack past echt bij al die gore, zo van die heel dreigende elektronische filmmuziek.
Maar wat de kroon steekt zijn de doods kreten en kermende, kreunende (neen, niet de Kreuners) slachtoffers die je bewerkt hebt met je kettingzaag (jaaaah!), je shotgun, machinegeweer en zelfs vlammenwerper!
Tussenin word je heel soms getrakteerd op animatiescenes.

Voor iedereen die eens een heel gewelddadig platform/actie game wil proberen is dit zeker het spelen waard!

Happy ripping and tearing !

author: {'steamid': '76561197990913342', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1626560335}
review:
A short, blunt and unfair shooter with an excellent edgy presentation and some concrete gameplay. Butcher wears its heart on its sleeve, along with several other organs. It doesn't fail to deliver a difficult experience but does so at the expense of some design elements.

In Killer you're a Kill-Bot and you gotta Kill Earth. Get going, champ. Murderer puts almost all focus on 2D platforming gunplay with an emphasis on alpha strikes where whoever hits the other first probably wins. There's a bit of exploration for secret hunting. Even on lowest difficulty you're about two hits away from death at all times so I went with Harder to at least keep health/armor pick-ups. Slaughterer doesn't really have a difficulty curve, the starting enemies can execute you on sight and so can the later enemies. Gunfire can be evaded but requires constant, precise motion or more reasonable awareness of nearby cover. Usually enemies obey line of sight(so get close and shotgun them from behind) but there were half as many times I was targeted and shot at through solid cover(instead of semi-solid platforms you can jump/drop through.) To the games credit nothing has wallhack weaponry that also sees through them.

Deli Prep Chef has a really solid core. The rules are very harsh but they're usually consistent. Once you're used to the game getting to the end of it is a given. I felt appreciation for the needs a good combat engine gives you: managing ammo, positioning, knowing where you can fallback to, following where enemies move to to avoid flanks, swapping to weapons as needed, even taking advantage of blind corners to chainsaw solitary enemies. The traps are inventive and clever and the enemy roster is just dense enough(where every enemy is a big threat) to keep each level fresh. The labor of love detail on the sprite graphics, the enemy death gibs, the blood decorating the drab metal structures and the oppressive environments with the violent, quick gameplay and headbanging soundtrack really shines when everything is in sync. The satisfaction from good gunplay in this game seems a given with the Soldat devs.

Trouble comes from a few sources, the worst being teleporting enemies. Considering the gorgeous sprawling layouts of the levels I'm surprised every enemy spawn isn't planned with some environmental cue, whether the enemies are set in deliberate spots(about half of them are) or would come in with fair warning. Instead you get a tiny blue sparkle, 1 second, and you're in danger. It can happen at any time, even mid-wave, so you're fighting and kiting enemies and a flamethrower teleports in near you. In a game with frequent near instant deaths this is inexcusable. In Butcher's larger levels it is criminally bad. The worst offender that sticks with me is dropping into a wall crusher trap with three switches to guess an order to to escape. Pushing the first two buttons correctly spawns shotgunners out of thin air to gib you while your eyes are focused on the switches and walls. Die surprised, repeat six combat sections to get back there. Dreadful. With as much attention and detail as the sprite work has some background doors with rotating sirens would have done much better. At times the enemies are previewed properly, so why the teleporting?

Where Terminator's flaws really irritate is longer levels with multiple combats and bad teleporter set-up. I get it. Game hard. The levels are often short and can be cleared in 1-2 minutes each, the speed run starts at 90 minutes total. But learning a long level with 4-8 difficult encounters and repeatedly dying near the end is agony. Repetition can turn the thrill of battle into repeating combat as a punishment. 1-2 checkpoints per level would be a net gain. Take the last level of Lost City: learn the first arena, learn the second arena, progress through the level steadily, every time I make a big mistake go repeat those first two arenas to the point of zero danger muscle memory. When Flesher is bad it's a chore to play, slowing your progress to a snail's pace or just beating level memorization into you. There's skill to a wave coming in and needing to accurately cut down multiple enemies just to have a safe quadrant of the room. Teleporting four shotgunners next to you and the only way to learn of this is to hit the switch that does it is just cheesy.

It's a short brutish "Git Gud" experience where mastery is rewarding if at times tedious, although there's an easy mode free DLC. Assuming you don't get stuck too often or for too long it's about 1-2 hours of game to beat. The quality of the game(warts and all) make it worth the $10 up front even for a one and done and is a nice pick-up on sale. If you really get into the game then mastering harder difficulties and speedrunning the game adds a lot of playtime. There's also a level editor and shared player levels for extra good times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198876795827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1623955493}
review:
Butcher is a gory, action-packed delight. From the get-go, the game provides vibes that are reminiscent of familiar properties like Doom, Predator, Aliens, and other horror/action films of the late 80's / early 90's. Moreover, the music is thematically dark and uptempo - it's hard not to get pumped up while you're wiping out scores of measly humans! 

The game proudly advertises itself as being difficult and this claim is quite right! Butcher does not hold your hand and certainly expects you to 'get good' quickly as the ruthless enemies will not wait idly for you to figure out your aim or move into cover. However, in opposition to what some negative reviews might say, I don't think the difficulty is overbearing. Ultimately, an emphasis on precise aiming and an understanding of the 'cover system' will allow the player to make quick work of even the toughest of opponents (i.e. thin platforms allow jumping/dropping through and bullets to pass but thick platforms can only be stood atop and block bullets). Fret not however, as the dev team appears to have listened to the negative feedback about difficulty and added an 'easy' mode DLC to make the game a little more approachable for more 'casual-leaning' folks.

Butcher has great pixel art, music, and tight controls which all make for a great game that you can complete in about 3-5 hours. Given the short playtime, I'd suggest waiting for a big sale to maximize value but I'd also argue that the game is a good value even at the full purchase price.

review: This game has to little to offer in a variety of categories. Mechanics, fun and pixels. Just a few more pixels would've helped. Also I personally think it's too difficult as well - I get that you're trying to be 'hardcore', but for me, and seemingly a big part of the people who gave this game a shot, this just killed the fun within minutes of playing the game, seeing as only 30% of players on Steam complete the first level. I would've preferred if it would've been more easy to get into and then got gradually harder instead of being frustrating in the first level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198833253978', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1679560090}
review:
This game should be a lot more popular, i have only had this retro 2D shooter  for 2 days and barely scratched the surface, but so far i really recommended it. 100% is worth the cost, especially if you get a discount or sale. No point not to buy when on sale, sooo worth the price. Things to note, this game is very fast paced and purely skill based. The Game is pretty difficult, though once you get good at the game controls and mechanics it can be soo rewarding. It is quite violent and gory, considering that the graphics look like they came from the gameboy, so therefor appropriate for most age levels. The pixelated graphics are amazing and the art style is sooo good. The game looks overall just amazing, and the sound track is also very good. The campaign it self makes the game worth it, but the level editor is awesome. so much potential for making awesome maps, for example side scrollers, par core, death challenges or just normal arena fights. the level editor is very non-user friendly, although by using the example levels already in the game i could figure it out (also i'm making a level editor tuturial video on youtube, check it out if your stuck at OzGames). you can publish your own levels and play other people levels they have played. the combination of the level editor, campaign and ability to publish and play other people's levels online makes this game 100% worth it and easily plenty of content. 

My final evaluation is 8.5 out of 10. The game art style and soundtrack is amazing. It is really fun and difficult, but rewarding, and has loads of content. if you are a doom, duke Nukem, or fast paced FPS fan, this 2d plat-former shooter is for you. Although the only major downfall of the game is the low player base, because of the lack of good online levels (although this could also be lack of rating system for online levels so the massive amounts of bad levels drown out the good ones). you could fix this by buying the game and playing it. if you are considering buying this game, two words, buy it. totally worth it. 100%. lots of fun. game is GUD.

EDIT: the online community is pretty good. i was looking in the wrong place for online levels, it is on steam workshop not ingame. diffently some really nice levels to install. overall, i mark the game 9.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007738668', 'num_games_owned': 2286, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1619752836}
review: So This game is definitely not for me, however, it is exactly what it portrays itself to be. A violent twitch fest slug-a-thon, it is "rage quit" with guns. I was kind of hoping for more of a metroidvania-eque type thing, but no. Is it a bad game? No, it works, and has key binding, and was working in all different kinds of resolution, full screen and windowed. But the "trial and error" in this game goes beyond where I draw the line. Maybe in the future I might want to play it, I will definitely keep it in my library. And I will recommend it IF what I described above is your thing. Just because I did not enjoy it, does not mean it is a bad game. It is true to the videos on the store page, so check them out. Cheers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340847703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 310, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1615760742}
review:
Quick Description:
-Butcher is a brutal, bloody, carnal, 2d Doom-like action platformer.  It may not have the most eye popping aesthetic that so many other shooters have, but it makes up for it with fun, frantic, chaotic gameplay and solid mechanics.  You will need to be persistent as you will likely die a ton, but every death is just a step closer to completing a satisfying difficult and rewarding section.

What's Good:
-The guns pack a punch are all really fun.  You feel the impact when you shoot shotguns.  Hearing the screams as you burn your victims alive w/ a flame thrower is brutal, but oh so sweet.  There are a ton of different guns and each one is unique and serves a specific purpose.
-Far more strategic than you would expect going in.  This is a really challenging game w/ lots of enemies and limited ammo.  This means that you need to be very selective on which gun you use to kill which enemy.  Some portions feel like puzzles w/ guns.  I really liked the balance between frantic chaos and strategy.  
-Like Doom, there are a ton of tough challenges and gobs of different enemy types.  You will be locked in an enclosed section surrounded by enemies, but there is always a way to survive if you are strategic.  Enemies range from suicide bombers that run straight at you, to terminator-like units that shoot homing missiles, to planes that shoot rockets at you, to guys w/ jet-packs and flamethrowers, etc.
-Very high skill ceiling.  This can be a double edge sword as it usually means that it is more difficult getting started, but it also means that you are rewarded for not giving up and being persistent.  You will be forced to try new tactics, making you better at the game.  I really love this aspect of Butcher.
-Awesome soundtrack which is a must for a game like this.

Could Use a Few Changes:
-Very high barrier of entry.  This game is not for the faint of heart and I noticed a lot of negative reviews w/ less than one hour of play time.  It can be really intimidating getting started.  The devs could have probably added one more level that helped introduce the mechanics, but I guess that wasn't there vision.  They want to throw you in the deep end right away.
-Tiny pixels w/ a very far away camera view will likely turn off some players.  It took me some time to get used to this.  Admittedly, at first I kept getting shot from a enemy that I didn't notice on screen.  This is the trade off to having a wide camera view of the environment for better or for worse.
-There are no checkpoints in the levels, so even if you die at the very last part of the very final section of the level, you will start from the beginning.  This feels really brutal in the later levels.  It's add tension but can be extremely frustrating.

Thoughts:
-I love these kinds of games so I had a really good time overall.  This isn't going to win game of the year awards, but it's just a solid well rounded 2d action platformer.  It's gritty, dark, and will challenge you every step of the way.  Butcher is not for everyone, but if you like games like Doom, Broforce, Ruiner, or Carrion, then this will probably be a great fit for you.

Consensus:
-Solid Game (Makes up 35% of my reviews).  This is an easy recommendation for fans of the genre.  If you haven't played it yet, add it to your library and don't look back.

author: {'steamid': '76561199005963202', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1612296310}
review:
[h1] Ein oldschool 2D-Shooter, dessen Mechanik etwas veraltet wirkt [/h1]

[b] Einleitung: [/b]
Du bist ein Cyborg mit einer einzigen Misson: Die letzten Reste der Menschheit auszurotten. Und das so gewalttätig wie man möchte, egal ob mit einer Kettensäge oder einer Schrotflinte. Und das macht theoretisch auch Spaß! Aber es ist gleichzeitig auch verdammt schwer! Wie ich es insgesamt fand möchte ich nun erläutern.

[b] Gameplay: [/b]
Das Gameplay ist simpel: Man läuft in einer 2D-Perspektive durch verschiedene Level von A nach B und musst unterwegs alles töten was sich bewegt. Zum Teil muss man das auch tun um voranzukommen. Ansonsten hat man eine Auswahl an verschiedenen Waffen, welche auch alle Spaß machen, aber das Gameplay auch nicht krass verändert. Aber es wird eine Menge Blut spritzen, das kann ich versprechen!

[b] Atmosphäre, Stil und Musik: [/b]
Die Atmosphäre und Setting ist durchgehend düster, was auch definitiv zum Stil des Spiels passt. Dazu gefällt mir der Pixelstil des Spiels sehr, auch wenn es jetzt natürlich nicht das Rad neu erfindet. Die Musik passt ebenso zum Spiel, auch wenn diese auch keine richtigen Banger hat.

[b] Schwierigkeit: [/b]
Der gleichzeitig beste und schlechteste Grund dieses Spiel zu spielen. Das Spiel wirbt damit, dass es recht schwer ist und demnach sehe ich das nicht als Kritikpunkt, da man vorgewarnt wurde. Dennoch würde ich mir einen Modus wünsche, wo der Schwierigkeitsgrad etwas humaner wäre. Eigentlich habe ich nichts gegen schwere Spiele, aber dieses "Try and Error" ist nichts für mich".

[b] Fazit: [/b]
Ich würde mehr zu dem Spielen sagen können, aber wie ich sagte, ich konnte es nicht sehr weit spielen und kann demnach nur sagen wie ich es empfande. Und das Spiel ist ziemlich Okay tatsächlich. Nichts besonderes, aber wenn Leute das Genre und Retro mögen ist es wirklich einen Blick wert! Mein einziges Manko ist, dass es halt 10 Euro kostet. Das finde ich persöhblich dann doch etwas viel für dieses Spiel. Vielleicht spiele ich es irgendwann nochmal und änder meine Meinung, aber bis dahin empfehle ich es nicht unbedingt bzw lest euch am besten noch andere Reviews durch!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979307379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1680674057}
review:
Achtung...nix für Kinder, das Spiel wäre Anfang der 90er sicher auf dem Index gelandet!!! :D
Pixelgewalt mit viel Blut, bis zum Exzess. Seine innovative Steuerung und das fetzig schnelle Gameplay versetzen Euch in diesem Pixelshooter schnell in einen Blutrausch. Die Level sind schwer, sehr schwer, aber schaffbar und das ist auch gut so, denn das macht das Spiel auch irgendwie aus!!!

Der Titel ist nix für Weichflöten, die sollten lieber Blumen pflücken gehen!!!
Frustresistenz und der unbedingte Wille das Level zu beenden gehören zum Gameplay dazu!!!

Ich hoffe ja auf eine Fortsetzung des Titels!?

System: Amiga 500 Plus mit 1mb Speichererweiterung

author: {'steamid': '76561198131322923', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1609175491}
review:
[h1]  Пиксельный  Doom slayer'вич Терминаторивич [/h1] 

[b] Предисловие. [/b] Когда увидел BUTCHER, то у меня возникло чуство настольгии (давным-давно я поиграл в браузерные игры The Breach и Vox Populi, Vox Dei, а в этом году в Perdition) и тогда я решил её купить. Что в итоге получилось об этом ниже.

[b] Сюжет. [/b] А в этой игре есть сюжет? Да, в убийстве людей и всё. Поэтому со временем игра начинает наскучивать, т.к нехватает motivation и всего такого.

[b] Игровой процес. [/b] Весь тот опыт, что представить испытать игроку описывается в трейлере. Море крови, кишки на крюках, бензопила с которой течёт кровища - это про BUTCHER.

[b] Музыка. [/b] Ost в игре неплох, но не запоминается. 

[b] Недостатки. [/b] Иногда враги сливаюся с текстурами( трупов, окружения ), большинство оружия ситуативные или беспозезные, единственный босс в игре никчёмный.

[b] Итог. [/b] Хороший мясной экшон на ~ 4 часа с неплохой музыкой.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989385375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1663578271}
review:
I thought this would be a good game to play when all I want to do is massacre a bunch of people.  Unfortunately not.

The game just isn't gratifying with how it plays.  There isn't any feel to what you're doing and the enemies are just too annoying.  I saw the comparison to Super Meat Boy and it has about that level of "you have to memorize the best path" which was my least favorite part about SMB.  

I like playing a game that I make up my actions on the fly, I don't like seeing how good of a robot I can be.

The graphics are not bad, but don't telegraph what is happening well enough to feel like you know what you're looking at, at least with less than 5 hours into the game.  Is that thing moving?  Is it gore?  Is it going to shoot you?  I dunno, but it's not helping me know what I should be doing about it!

Interesting premise, but not all of us are whores for completion and difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026983716', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1602403162}
review:
(note: time played is a little inaccurate. i played this game while streaming and took maybe a total of 1.5 hours worth of breaks total time to beat was around 5-5.5 hours on the "Harder" difficulty)

i adore this game. i beat it on the "Harder" difficulty around 2 months ago to get in the mood for Halloween and it did the job. this game is difficult. extremely difficult. BUT there is no reason for failure other than yourself. with the exception of a few levels, levels are short enough so that if you do end up dying late in the level, it doesn't feel so bad to make your way back.

some of the people who don't like the game or are not recommending it for whatever reason seem to have weird issues with it. "enemies are too small/too hard to see" is the equivalent of hating dark souls when Patches f**ks you over in the Tomb of Giants or when you go into a room full of barrels, but they're filled with black powder and some trash enemy throws a bomb and you explode. 

first off, they're not hard to see. 
second off, learn their position (enemies spawn at the same places each time with the exception of some arena/wave areas) and don't die by that.
third off, get good.

this game is amazing. personally, i enjoyed it better than i did Carrion and it's the difficulty that pushed it in favor for BUTCHER.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008059406', 'num_games_owned': 4581, 'num_reviews': 426, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1607328404}
review:
둠을 플랫포머로 옮겨 놓은듯한 게임

스샷으로 보면 도트가 느낌있는데 게임 해보면 생각 보다 투박해서 좀 구린 느낌을 받았음
분위기는 있는데, 눈이 좀 불편한 느낌
여기다 폰트도 도트로 찍어놨는데 너무 가독성이 떨어져서 처음 메인화면에서부터 인상이 별로 좋지는 않았음

플랫포머이긴 한데 한게임이 호흡이 상당히 짧음
맵이 쭉 이어지면서 중간중간 체크포인트 식이 아니라 챕터별로 미션이 따로 있는 구성이라 그런듯
그리고 미션 목표역시 별 내용없이 걍 일자 진행으로 나오는 적들 다 썰고 지나 가면되는 구성이라
좀 밋밋한 느낌이 들었음 물론 난이도를 높여서 공략 하는 맛을 줄 수 는 있는데 너무 단순해서 쉽게 질리는 구성이었던것같음

컨셉은 좋았으나.. 컨셉에서 끝난 게임이라고 생각함
가격이 싸서 할만은 한데 추천날리고 싶지는 않음

author: {'steamid': '76561198126367972', 'num_games_owned': 1235, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1607273983}
review:
[h1] Rzeź pełnią mocy w pile łańcuchowej! [/h1]
Butcher to jedna z tych gierek, na zabicie czasu czy uzupełnienie go o krótkie rozgrywki.
Graficznie bardzo prosto - pixelowo, dobrze, choć czasami taki bałagan, że ciężko coś dostrzec. Na plus ciekawa graficznie mechanika latających flaków przeciwników.
Audio wystarczające, muzyka nadająca tempa, wrzaski przeciwników, krztuszenie się etc - spoko.
Mechanicznie i gameplayowo gierka spoko - na początku luźniejsze poziomy, które z czasem stają się coraz trudniejsze, kilka rodzajów broni, różnorodni przeciwnicy; brak fabuły, ale przy takim czasie gry i jej zamyśle, jest ona tu zbędna.
[b] Krótko i na temat. Warto zagrać, fajna gra dla ludzi, którzy dążą do zdobywania osiągnięć oraz speedrunnerów. Dla mnie gra na 5h i była to dobra zabawa, choć czasem irytująca. Na zakończenie smaczek dla fanów filmu Terminator, choć nie taki, jakiego by się człowiek spodziewał.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197969062133', 'num_games_owned': 2114, 'num_reviews': 1251, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1606531983}
review: I like the vibe, you play some sort of AI or alien hunter-killer trying to wipe out human life, and you gun and chainsaw your way through grimy industrial levels with blood splattering everywhere. I just found the gameplay more frustrating than fun.  You collect health, armor, and ammo pickups, with enemies dropping more when you kill them (though they despawn fast so you have to pick them up), but if you die that's it. You have to restart the level all the way from the beginning. They're not particularly long, but later levels can usually be broken down into several parts, and it's just exhausting to make it to the last part of the level, always the most difficult, and die only to respawn back at the beginning and have to jump through the same hoops just to get back to the last location you died over and over until you finally beat it.  On top of that the enemies have perfect aim, and while staying on the move helps early on it can't reliably dodge all enemy fire such as shotguns at close range. Since enemies teleport in, sometimes right on top of you, you're bound to take damage unless your reflexes are quick or you memorize the spawns. I give it points for style but found the gameplay tiring.

review: I've played more than 2 hours most being offline. The game is not a quirky shooter that pays tribute to the side scroller shooters of the past. The NPC's and yourself are so small it looks like lemmings with guns. I stopped on Old Military Base level 4 where the skull requires you to jump into a saw. author: {'steamid': '76561197977146636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1605664241}
review:
Not really.
Its a really blant sidescrolling shooter without any genuine depth.
The pixelart is solid and its a fresh bloody take to be a villain (?).
However, theres basically no story to be found, no narrative, the pixelart doesnt do anything to get a story across.
It further comes with a really limited loadout (shotgun, rifle, grenadelauncher, flamethrower, chainsaw and lasercanon).
Most of the time, you will use shotgun and rifle. 
Thats it.
The levels do not involve puzzles, no exploration as they are following a clear path, no branching, no alternative paths and the secrets are mostly laughable.

What is left, is a blant sidescrolling shooter with solid pixelgraphic, no replayability, no real unlocks besides a new difficulty and lacking gameplay.
I have seen plenty sidescrolling shooters that were better and brought more to the table.
To underline that sentiment: [u]Only 30% of the users have finished the first world.[/u]
-> Not because its hard and not because it long, it roughly takes 10 minutes if you need several retries.
I endured it to the 5th world and then quit playing because it really was just enduring it and not fun.
What pushed me that far was the completionist in me that wanted me to finish it.
But there are just better games to spend my time on.
With getting to the 5th world, i seem to be a rare unicorn. 
Only roughly 9% of all players made it that far according to the steam statistics.
It seems that 70% of the players were more clever than me, quitting right away before finishing the first few short and quite easy levels.
And rightfully so.

The least i expected were branching levels and a more open level structure to explore areas to allow me to do every level differently, choose a different path and even get to the end in different ways, like killing mainly with traps, sneaky or whatever.
But it goes from one arena with pixel enemies to the next.
Since it cant deliver on such a basic expectation, it turned out to be total standard. Nothing special.
In fact, i feel like its more a proof of concept rather than a fully fleshed out game.

I say dont do it, except you really need to play every sidescrolling shooter out there. 
Then it might be an experience. Not a good one though.
If not and you are picky with your games, then there are better alternatives.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979724838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1481224088}
review: A shooty platformer that sells itself on its oldschool difficulty. Unfortunately the [i]real[/i] difficulty is actually identifying your targets among the perpetual sea of blood, explosions, fire, and molten slag. It's very pretty and gritty pixel art and I'm sure was a labor of love, it's just a shame that nobody thought to tweak the combat difficulty to compensate for the artificial difficulty inflicted by the graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021001217', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1603483272}
review: I'm not usually one to complain about a game's art style, as my enjoyment of a given title boils down to  whether or not I find the gameplay itself fun, but this game's art direction is a major flaw in my opinion, as the incredibly low resolution makes it harder to follow the action than it should be. The player character and the starter enemies each consist of only a handful of pixels, so with blood and bullets spraying everywhere, it just becomes annoying to follow what's actually happening on screen. After only several levels, I decided that my eyes had had enough. It's too bad, as I think this game could be a lot of fun with higher resolution, better character designs, and the camera zoomed in a bit more.
