author: {'steamid': '76561198810754603', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1665506170}
review:
РАЗРАБОТЧИК:
Phobia Game Studio, Transhuman Design

ИЗДАТЕЛЬ:
Crunching Koalas, Transhuman Design 

BUTCHER — это напряженная двухмерная стрелялка и пропитанная кровью открытка из ранних 90-х.

Вы — киборг, запрограммированный уничтожить последние остатки человечества, и ваша единственная задача... мочить все что движется.

Хватайте любимую пушку (от бензопилы и дробовика до гранатомета) и прожигайте себе дорогу сквозь подземные убежища, разрушенные войной города, джунгли и так далее. 
А если в вас проснется творческая жилка — расправляйтесь с противниками со вкусом: к вашим услугам крюки, ямы с лавой, циркулярные пилы... каждая смерть будет особенной.

Если вам нравится сталкивать трупы в лаву и заливать стены кровью, то BUTCHER — это игра для вас.

Самый простой режим — 'СЛОЖНЫЙ'!

Особенности:

Море безумного насилия в стиле Doom и Quake (бензопила прилагается)

Успех в игре зависит только от ваших навыков

Спустите с цепи своего внутреннего художника: раскрасьте стены (несмывающейся) кровью (до 4 миллионов пикселей холста на каждом уровне)

Используйте элементы окружения (пилы, крюки, ямы с лавой, животных и многое другое), чтобы жестоко расправляться с противниками

К вашим услугам целый арсенал оружия (в том числе такая классика, как бензопила, рельсотрон, здоровенный гранатомет)

Более 20 уровней, которые вам предстоит забрызгать кишками противников

Окунитесь во мрачную атмосферу с головой — пинайте трупы туда-сюда под брутальную тяжелую музыку

Умирайте в мучениях: растворяйтесь в лаве, кормите пираний, хрустите костями под тяжелыми дверями... вариантов сдохнуть множество!

РЕЦЕНЗИИ

“HARDCORE”

John Romero

“2015 год порадовал меня многими играми, но только Butcher удалось вызвать искреннюю улыбку на моем лице.”

Kotaku

“Не мне судить, почему вам может так доставить палить из ружья по двухмерным пикселям, но я однозначно рекомендую вам Butcher.”

Rock, Paper, Shotgun

ЧТО ГОВОРЯТ ВАШИ КУРАТОРЫ

Phobia Game Studio -

"BUTCHER is a brutal fast-paced game we made before forming Phobia Game Studio."

Indie Games Poland Foundation - 

"Showed at PAX West 2017 - BUTCHER is a fast-paced 2D shooter and a blood-soaked love letter to the cult classics of the genre."

author: {'steamid': '76561197974210341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1598795988}
review:
In terms of other games, Butcher is basically what you'd get if Super Meat Boy and Doom did the nasty and raised a little game-child together. Not surprisingly, the kid doesn't have a great temperament and is VERY difficult; strongly advise you start off on the 'Hard' setting.

Like in Meat Boy, you'll frequently die and have to restart the level again, but levels are fairly short so this isn't too painful. Unlike Meat Boy, you can take a bit of damage here and there without dying, and health/armor pickups are available to keep you going. Though cross-hair aiming and moving can take some time to get used to, the controls are tight and responsive, and you never feel 'cheated' when you get killed. Base game is fairly short at ~20 levels and is reflected in the price, but the level-editor/workshop extends the longevity with custom levels.

As per the ads/artwork, the aesthetics of the game have Doom written all over them. Environments are dark, gritty, and industrial, leaving the clear impression that the little sprites inhabiting them are going to have a brutally bad time. Enemies are violently torn apart in response to most weapons, leaving oodles of blood and gore splattered over anything nearby. They can also be kicked/baited into many of the deadly environmental hazards you'll encounter, with delightfully macabre results. Weapons are standard fps fare and aren't particularly remarkable as far as mechanics go, though I really like the behaviour of the flamethrower. The retro/'pixelized' visuals may not be for everyone, but as a fan of that art style I think the assets and textures look fantastic and really gel together. Not surprisingly, music is in the midi/chiptune vein and fits the game perfectly, so if you liked the tracks in Doom, you're certain to enjoy some from Butcher.

Only real gripe I have is with how some aspects of the platform combat and line-of-sight work. You and your enemies can shoot one another through the 'thin' platforms you walk on, but not through thicker surfaces. Firefights often take place where the two meet, and they sometimes blend together well enough that during a frantic battle it can be difficult to tell at-a-glance when you're in cover or in danger. Also think it would be more fun/tense if you had the same vision as your enemies, who can't see through thick walls/floors like you can; makes many of the encounters feel like a chore rather than a tense standoff. If the line-of-sight worked more like Teleglitch or something, I think it would make for a much more adrenaline-pumping experience.

Overall, however, I think Butcher is a really great game and definitely worth picking up if the idea of platforming with guns in Super Doom World sounds like something you'd enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973993275', 'num_games_owned': 1944, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1595458578}
review:
[h1] Doom and Super Meat Boys secret love child[/h1]

[list][b]YEA![/b]
    [*]Fast paced combat with nice selection of weapons but has the typical enemies have clear cut weaknesses in later levels
    [*]Fun and addicting, you always want to keep retrying to push towards completing that level, levels are mostly short enough not to be annoying while trying multiple times
    [*]Its just bloody brutal
[/list]

[list][b]MEH![/b]
    [*]Graphics are ok, but nothing to write home about, sprites could be a little bigger to show off more detail
    [*]Difficulty for me didn't really hit to the 5th chapter, final boss can be rage inducing
    [*]Controller setup has auto aim lock on vs. the mkb, which could give an easier play through.
[/list]

[list][b]BLEH![/b]
    [*]No restart from menu while practicing speedruns
    [*]No tutorial skippage
    [*]Wish skulls unlocked something and not just there for "puzzle solving"
[/list]

[b]How it Runs:[/b]
No issues, you can expect it to run solid on a potato. As i was able to run this on my desktop with 0 issues and Surface Pro 6 i5 8gb held a steady 60fps

[i]The Gist:[/i]

You get one shot to get to the exit gate killing everything in your path, its bloody and fun. The levels consist of basically moving room to room while finding switches to open the next door or clearing out the spawning enemies to force the next door to open. I completed the game with both mkb and controller and would suggest using a controller as it provides a slightly less of a difficulty curve, as well as providing a more paced out combat flow with the cursor lock on. While the game can be difficult its not impossible or cheap in its execution and is well worth full price for anyone who likes fast paced  2D action platform games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039476470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1697720512}
review:
Şimdi bu oyun, tam benim quake'den yadigâr kalan uzay 'da dehşet ve gotik ortam merakımı karşılar diye aldım. Nitekim karşıladı da. Ancak bu zorluk seviyesi nedir eey yapımcı arkadaşlar! Oyun öyle bir oyun ki, sırf oyunu kolaylaştıran bir dlc çıksa alacağım. asdfsafsdf

Gerçi demişler oyunun başında, "bu oyunun easy'si hard'dan başlar, gerçek erkekler pause kullanmaz" diye. Sanırım kodlamada bir yerde farkında olmadan aşırı zor olduğunu beta aşamasından sonra anlayıp bir daha geri dönememiş bağımsız yapımcı emekçi dostlar. Sağlık olsun. Sırf oynayamadığım için iade ediyorum. İçimden eski sevgiliye edilen küfür gibi sözler geçiyor ancak yine de kıyamıyorum...:'/

Özet: Oyunu kolaylaştırın 10 üzerinden 9 basayım.

30.07.22  düzenleme : 
__________________
Evet, yapımcılar, oyunun zor olduğunu kendileri de fark etmiş olacaklar ki, oyuna kolay mod eklemişler (kalbim temizmiş:) )
bu açıdan bize de düşen puanını artırmak ve tavsiye etmek. 

lakin bunu bir yama değil de bir dlc'yi bedava sunarcasına göstermeleri de gözümden kaçmadı. :)
 Belli ki hata değil sizin isteklerinize  hizmet veriyoruz havası yaratmışlar. 
Ne olursa olsun piksel platform sevenler mutlu, teşekkürler ekip! 

9 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198074521513', 'num_games_owned': 1116, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1416, 'last_played': 1592615229}
review:
Amazing game. Bought this in a bundle on Humble Bundle for about 20p and oh boy I loved it. Challenging gameplay and mechanics you have to learn. I played this game on the Hardest difficulty first and I'm so glad i did, it made me realise how easy "Hard" was and set me up nicely for the Speedrun achievements and learning the levels and the best way to beat them. The Speedrun for 45 minutes was a very nice challenge that i thoroughly enjoyed practicing for.
Great game, Great value for money. One of the best 100%'s i've done. 10/10. Will miss playing you.
Love,
The BUTCHER King

author: {'steamid': '76561198028391668', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1588825805}
review:
It was so close to being good; the gore, fast paced, action, interesting level design, and nostalgic gameplay are all great BUT...
Whoever did the artwork for this game needs to learn a very important word; "contrast." Enemies in this game are aim bots. They just don't miss shots so if you don't fire first and accurately, you're boned. Typically this is a completely fair mechanic. For BUTCHER, the issue is not aiming, it's figuring out where the hell the enemies even are. It's so difficult to see anything in this game. The enemies either need more contrast or the artstyle as a whole needed to be upgraded to a higher resolution. 
The game is a mess but it's built on a fun foundation which makes you suffer through it hoping your skill will make the experience less frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983954575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1588689580}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986853226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 301, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1588653571}
review:
I want to like BUTCHER. The gore is nicely over the top, the brutal atmosphere is well executed, and the interface is slick. However, the extremely grainy artstyle clashes with the demanding gameplay in a way I find unplayable.

Everybody (enemies and yourself) can shoot through the ground. This should be fine, except the enemies also have an extremely long range of vision. Combine all this with multi-level rooms, and it's hard to tell if you're getting shot by something just off screen or one tiny pixel that represents an enemy's head in the lower left. Sometimes it's the tiny pixel representing part of a foe you literally couldn't distinguish from the background or the flashy traps of the stage. Othertimes, it's impossible to tell.

Some may call this experience "hardcore". I call it tedious, annoying, and ultimately a waste of time.

The developers who made this clearly have skill. I'd advising waiting on whatever they put out next instead of getting this, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071357475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 393, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1590118085}
review:
Este es un juego fascinante. Con una premisa interesantisima y un apartado artistico que a pesar de ser muy minimalista es terriblemente sobrecogedor. Al igual que su descorazanada accion brutal.

¿porque le pongo este puntaje? porque sus desarrolladores estubieron muy sesgados al limitar su publico. Porque este juego no esta hecho para cualquiera sino para los ultrahardcore gamers que no les importa morir un millon de veces para terminar el juego. Posiblemente sera porque si lo pasaras de corrido lo terminarias en un abrir y cerrar de ojos. Pero su tematica es terriblemente espectacular para estar dedicada solamente al publico hardcore.

Y lamentablemente no he podido reembolsarlo porque supere las horas de juego. Por querer seguir intentando terminarlo. 

Bastaba simplente una pequeña accion del estudio en ponerle aunque sea la dificultad normal o facil. Pero no. Este juego es exclusivo para el club de los hardcore. Excluyendo a todos los demas.

No lo recomiendo a menos que te gusten juegos como dark souls o sekiro en paltaformas y shoter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010155821', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1584818923}
review:
[h1] Paint the map red [/h1]
Indie games can be many things.  Some follow it for their creative freedom, to others it is a way to keep gaming despite limited hardware capabilities, and to others still it is a change of pace after the loud and big AAA titles. Butcher probably fits best into the third category, it’s a simple and gory gimmick that can be finished in one sitting. And that’s perfectly fine.

Butcher’s gameplay is a mix of platformer and dynamic firefights. Clear a room of enemies, avoid a large sawblade, listen as your victims scream in excruciating agony and leave the level. Repeat. The game’s premise is as simple as it gets – kill everything that moves and have fun while doing so. The entire thing comes in wrapping so edgy that I’ve cut my hand while trying to install the game and I don’t even own a physical copy.

[b] The easiest mode is ‘hard’ [/b]
Butcher doesn’t beat around the bushes. The players controls a combat-drone coming straight out of an assembly line deep within the bowels of an alien starship. A short cutscene introduces the single purpose of your existence –  to purge the Earth force. This is as far as the story goes. It’s just you, the guns and a lot of tiny pixel humans about to become a red mush. For a murder-machine of the future the arsenal at hand is very mundane –  a shotgun, a machinegun, a flamethrower and only a railgun to slightly stand out of the bunch. That said, every gun in Butcher has its use and soon you will be switching weapons on the fly to best respond to the next threat in your way.

Perhaps the mankind is about to go extinct but it doesn’t mean they will go down easily. Cybernetically enhanced warriors of reasonable variety will stand in your way and they have all the weapons you do. Combat drone may be able to take slightly more punishment (though on higher difficulties even that is no longer plausible) but a shotgun blast to the face is still going to kill you. To avoid an untimely demise, the drone has a ludicrous mobility that allows the player to dodge incoming projectiles. The game’s movement takes time to master but once you do, the adrenaline-fuelled rush of frantic violence is truly satisfying.

[b] Screaming bloody murder [/b]
The moment title screen starts raining blood, you quickly realise what Butcher is going for with its aesthetic. Much like the gameplay, it’s straight to the point. The entirety of the game is kept in greyish, faded colours with red being the only one to break the monotony. Believe me, there will be a lot of red around once you are done with the level. Pixelated as it is, Butcher is full of over-the-top gore with giants pools of blood, strung entrails, a lot of squishy sounds and tortured screams. The gritty visuals are perfectly complemented by the soundtrack filled with heavy electronic tones, all falling into one dystopian picture.

This one is exclusively a matter of taste; but to me Butcher is trying too hard to be edgy and brutal. It’s as if Butcher has found the elephant in the room, killed it, and now wears its tusks as trophies while trotting around where the poor animal used to be. The effect may be deliberate but it doesn’t make it any less obnoxious.

At the end of the day, Butcher is fully dedicated to a simple premise which it soundly delivers. It is difficult, visceral and it ends before it can overstay its welcome. Even on the first playthrough the title takes roughly 3 hours to finish. It does encourage the player to stay a while longer to try some speedrunning and there is also an integrated map builder to give the game a spark of longevity. Most of the players though, are likely to beat the game in an evening and forget it by the next morning. Butcher isn’t a groundbreaking game and it was never supposed to be. If you enjoy down-to-earth indie games and tiny, pixel intestine tract dangling over a railing is not something you find off-putting, do give Butcher a try. The game may not be pretty but much like its namesake, it gets the job done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017924360', 'num_games_owned': 1613, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1582403640}
review: Butcher  è uno sparatutto 2D rapido, difficile, brutale e adrenalinico, in cui interpreteremo un cyborg (chiaramente ispirato ai celebri Terminator dell’omonima saga cinematografica) in missione per eradicare l’ultima traccia di umanità rimasta nel mondo. Non ho usato a caso la parola difficile: questo gioco rappresenta una vera e propria sfida, inadatta a coloro che vogliono un prodotto leggero da godersi con spensieratezza, e basti pensare che lo slogan del gioco è: “La difficoltà più facile è Difficile”. O almeno, lo era inizialmente: in seguito a lamentele di diversi utenti PC che richiedevano una difficoltà più semplice o perlomeno “normale”, il team ha risposto implementando la modalità W.I.M.P. (per pappamolle, letteralmente), con cui il gioco assume un livello di difficoltà tremendamente facile, annullando ogni possibile senso di sfida. Il gioco è interamente giocabile dall’inizio alla fine e non subisce particolari variazioni (se non costanti agevolazioni al giocatore), però sconsigliamo chiaramente di provarlo a questo livello di difficoltà visto che è da reputarsi unicamente come “scherzo” da parte degli sviluppatori e, a nostro parere, annulla anche buona parte del divertimento finale. Il gioco in se non è molto lungo, ma i numerosi tentativi per portare a termine il livello allungheranno parecchio le ore di gioco. Se riuscirete a resistere alla frustrazione di morti dovute al semplice fatto che vi siete fermati troppo a lungo nello stesso punto, godrete di un esperienza unica nel suo genere. Oltre a vedere un mare di sangue. Consigliato per tutti gli appassionati di giochi adrenalinici, violenti e platform!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031617164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1579417430}
review:
부처

2D 횡스크롤 슈팅 플랫포머 게임.
부처는 buddha가 아니고, butcher임. 도살자라는 뜻.
뛰어 당기면서 총기로 적들을 학살하는 게임임.
도트 그래픽이지만 꽤 고어함. 분위기도 어둡고 음습함.
그래도 적들을 터뜨리는 타격감은 쩌는 듯.

문제는 난이도...
가장 쉬운 난이도가 hard고, 중간 난이도가 harder임.
나는 harder로 했는데... harder 모드는 별로 추천하진 않음. 어려워서 빡침.

총을 쏘는 걸 키로 조작하는 게 아니라 마우스로 360도 돌려가며 쏘는거라 조작이 어려움.
정말 온 신경을 집중해야 판을 깰 수 있음.
다만 정말 미친 듯이 어렵냐... 하면 그 정도는 아닌 듯.
harder 모드 기준으로, 전투는 꽤 힘들지만 돌아다니고 점프하는 플랫폼(바닥)에는 함정을 그리 많이 설치해 놓지는 않아서, 맵에 낚이거나 그런 것은 별로 없었음.

그 외에는 별로 특이한 점은 없는 평범한 게임임.
harder 난이도로 끝까지 깨는데 4시간 반 정도 걸림.
엄청 재밌지는 않았지만, 그냥 할 만한 했음.
난이도 있는 2D 플랫폼 슈팅 게임을 찾고 있다면 괜찮을 것임. 
추천.

진행도: 스토리 모드는 다 깸.
시크릿(해골)은 다 안 모음.

플레이 날짜: 2019.12. ~ 2020.1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038093457', 'num_games_owned': 1214, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1578838148}
review: It's quite fun dark sci-fi 2D shooter with lot of gore. Game is very short and focused on action, precision and beating records, which i don't  usually do that. Grahpics is pixelart. Overall art style looking quite good, but because of action speed, darkness and low res is hard to see anything. Butcher is nothing special, but can be entertainment for 2-3 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1578668726}
review:
Butcher is a 2D retro pixel platformer/twin stick shooter with a gritty "gore" theme.   The developers liken the game to DooM which is a good indication they're not in touch with gaming at all, because DooM was 3D, and also, DooM was a good game.

The ugly pixel graphics (seriously, hire an artist, stop making games that look bad on purpose, it's not "style", it's "lazy") make the mediocre gameplay much worse, as they're muddy and poorly defined even for pixel graphics.  It looks like you're trying to play an ultra high res game in 240p.   On top of that, menus are hard to navigate because the developers decided to map racing wheels/HOTAS controllers etc as if they were console peasant gamepads.    So, bad gameplay, worse graphics, shoddy controls, a lazy concept, and a hideous $14.50 price tag (for a 2D pixel game!)... impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059705384', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1617739688}
review:
Tohle není jenom 2D Doom. Tohle je doslova masakr. Zlikvidovat vše, co najdete v cestě, to je motto hry. Hardcore 2D střílečka, která opravdu neodpouští chyby. Gameplay je rychlý a nádherně smooth, gunplay je zábavný, člověk občas neví co si vzít a opravdu střídá všechny zbraně dle situace. 
Jednoduchá grafika, která ale esteticky je naprosto parádní ( zvlášť s CRT filtrem) a ten soudtrack tu prasáckou atmosféru nádherně doplňuje.

[b] + Rychlost gameplaye [/b]     [b] - Mohl by být multiplayer [/b]
[b] + Levely [/b]
[b] + Editor [/b]
[b] + Gunplay [/b]
[b] + Estetika a design [/b]
[b] + Soundtrack [/b]

review: Fast-paced, hardcore, brutal 2D shooter with style like old DOOM. Not convinced yet ? Levels in this game are quite diverse and throughout the gameplay you unlock new enemies and weapons so its not stale and boring.  Hard difficulty (which is the easiest) is, as it says, pretty hard and you will have "this is bullshit" moments but overally its a really good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198849946273', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1683369903}
review:
[b]Butcher[/b] é um game com o visual tão feio e controles mal pensados, que sua primeira impressão de Butcher é péssima. Mas insisti e joguei e gostei muito mesmo, este é um caso que prova que nem sempre a primeira impressão é a que fica. Butcher é muito divertido, e vale sim o dinheiro e tempo gastos nele.
O game tem um visual basicamente de pixels, mas isso acaba potencializando a violência sabe. Há coisas que poderiam ser nojentas, impressionantes, rica em detalhes em um visual mais realista, aqui ficam apenas engraçadas kkkkk. Por exemplo, você pode matar um inimigo e ele explode com o tiro da sua shotgun e se desfazer em tripas, que ficam penduradas pelo cenário.
No jogo tem uma arma apelona demais a Rail gun, você consegue desintegrar dezenas de inimigos com um único tiro. Tem também a nossa tão amada Shotgun, a tela treme quando você atira com ela, mata com um único tiro a curta distância e espalha sangue por todo o cenário. E muito satisfatório atirar com esta escopeta. A metralhadora é para longa distância, mata o inimigo com poucos tiros e sangue pra todo lado.
As outras armas são utilizadas para os inimigos mais fortes, elas têm uma barrinha de energia. São elas o popular lança-chamas, o lança-foguetes e a apelona rail gun. Aliás, o jogo não vai te ensinar isso, mas... se você segurar um pouquinho o botão de tiro, ela solta um ataque mais forte que mata mesmo os bichinhos que têm energia com um tiro só. Sem falar que o som deste tiro, combinado ao de carne se desfazendo e voando pra todo lado, é bastante satisfatório.

Há bastante diversão nesse game, mas para chegar a ela, você precisa ignorar o visual e os controles. Os controles são muito estranhos, você pula no W o espaço faz outra ação, enfim, você pode configurar como quiser depois, ou como eu, levará um tempo para se acostumar com os controles default. A [i]tagline[/i] de Butcher é que a dificuldade mais baixa é o [i]hard[/i], mas há também uma dificuldade casual. Se não quiser jogar no casual, também precisará de bastante paciência nas últimas fases, especialmente no último capítulo as coisas ficaram bem difíceis. Seus inimigos morrem fácil neh, o contrário funciona para você. Você pode estar com seu [i]life[/i] cheio, se sentindo o fod@o, mas um tiro bem dado pode te deixar quase sem energia, isso se não te matar de uma vez. Você deve estar sempre em movimento, mas cuidado com as armadilhas do cenário, essas sim te matam de uma vez. Cheguei até a pensar em desistir, mas insisti e consegui terminar. Este é um jogo que realmente fornece altos [i]bragging rights[/i] para aqueles que o terminarem.

Eu me diverti bastante durante a gameplay, altos [i]rage[/i] também kkkk para zerá-lo. Se a ideia de um jogo de tiro 2D [i]hardcore[/i] lhe chama atenção, compre, jogue e zere o game, vale muito a pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038776903', 'num_games_owned': 7260, 'num_reviews': 3814, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1577830555}
review:
[table][td][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/30253125]甄游组鉴赏家[/url][/td][td]千人福利群124925250、52756441[/td][/table]

受虐狂和是虐狂的像素鲜血狂宴。超爽但超难，射击手感爽，每关只有1~3分钟左右的短流程，但是容错率很低。敌人种类丰富，官方意识到玩家反馈太难后，特意制作了极简模式DLC。如此一来所有人都可以大开杀戒了！打的敌人肠穿肚烂，拔丝大肠黏在地上，垂在天花板上，杀出猪叫声！爽翻！每个关卡都很精致，拥有大量收集物品和多种难度可供反复挑战。这款游戏你不会抱怨敌人从你面前刷怪，反而内心呐喊：你们他妈再来啊！MORE！MORE！MORE！全都给你们打成肉泥！

最简模式快速通关大约1个多小时。
支持创意工坊。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993374159', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1577590235}
review: 6/10 : Je trouve que ce jeu à beaucoup d'ambition. Le pixel art gore rentre dans le tas c'est superbe, des beaux moments, belles musiques et cinématiques. En ce qui à rapport à la difficulté, le seul moment ou je l'ai trouvé juste et satisfaisante, c'est durant le boss Final. Ce jeu n'a juste pas besoin d'être aussi dur.. Je ne sais pas pour les autres, mais pour moi il n'y avait aucun sentiment de fierté après avoir passé un niveau, c'est dur pour rien et avec le level design moyen, c'est pas le jeu fait pour ça. Le mode facile est un dlc te traitant de wimp... C'est drôle, mais ça aurait aidé de l'avoir directement dans le jeu et non (être obligé de jouer a un die and repeat), car pour tout le reste le jeu reste très bon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198954064493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1576184312}
review:
I have played this game for significantly less than an hour on PC. I have, however, played the game in its entirety on the Xbox One. It's the game so good I bought it twice - I will let that fact speak for itself. I feel the same about the PC version as I do about the console edition, so here's the review I wrote for the Xbox store in 2017 -

User Rating: 4 out of 5
Submitted on 12/05/2017

"Excellent"

"Definitely worth owning at this price. Fast, loud, messy and unforgiving. Also features very appealing background and environment visuals which definitely bear the distinctive mark of Transhuman founder Michal Marcinkowski. Those who played MM's multiplayer title 'Soldat' years ago will know this is where he truly excels - fast paced, side scrolling, sprite-based insanity packed with nods to old shoot 'em ups and 80's action flicks. The music, too, is noteworthy; a dark, grinding industrial soundtrack that fits the setting perfectly. The only cloud on the horizon is potential lack of replay value. Once you complete the campaign, I don't think there's much to do, except do it again on a harder difficulty. As much as I hate to say it, a multiplayer mode could have been a lot of fun. Those minor details aside, however, the plain fact is if you're looking to waste a few hours indulging in utter savagery and feel challenged doing it, then Butcher will not disappoint."

In 2019, on a different platform entirely, I stand by this review. However, 2 years after I wrote it, I must add that the game now features a level editor, which I am certain will produce some outstanding community content.

In short - buy this game. Support this developer. They deserve it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299224226', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1576112009}
review:
I have to go to bed soon, but wanted a little pick up and play before I did that.
I had picked "Butcher" up inexpensively a short while ago and thought I'd give it a try.

It's hard as nails, so you keep trying and don't give up, then it's still hard as nails, but you get slightly better each time.  If you've played "Hotline Miami", this is similar in grungy 2D pixel art.

It's nicely put together and definitely keeps you on with the "one more go" sensibility, but by golly is it hard, but not *impossible*.

The aesthetics suit really well, thought I've only played the tutorial and am someway through the first set of levels and the sound design is fine.

Butcher is a visceral, muscle-clenching, exhilarating pixel-blood-bath.  I am utterly drained after less than an hour, in a good way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053754931', 'num_games_owned': 2188, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1622360959}
review:
[h1][b]Experiencias similares: Hotline Miami, Contra o DOOM (Pero en 2D y re pixelado )[/b][/h1]
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36430761-KurareMHM/][quote]Para más recomendaciones hace click wachin[/quote][/url]

Cumple su lema de publicidad: "Dificil es el modo facil", exige muchos reflejos, velocidad y puntería, ademas de pensar rapido.

La verdad al inicio parece como cualquier indie del tipo "lluvia de balas", pero nada que ver. Tiene una vibra muy similar a Hotline Miami, de hecho parece que es el resultado de un trio entre HotLine Contra y Doom, Aunque el bebutcher salio más difícil que los 3 mencionados.
 
Aunque los primeros niveles pueden ser de tipo "entra a una habitación u sobrevive"  el juego de a poco va mostrando más, teniendo que avanzar por los niveles llenos de trampas y enemigos, lo que nos obliga a racionar la munición que se acaba en un instante y afrontar todo tipo de enemigos diversos, desde pirañas a robots a Kamikazes. 
Aunque tenemos armadura y vida, hasta podemos encontrar en los escenarios y enemigos para regenerarnos la verdad es que pocas veces la IA fallara un disparo a no ser que nos movamos más rapido que las balas, lo cual hace que sea difícil ya que no hay casi margen de error

La verdad es un juego que esta muy bueno para quienes les gusto juegos tipo Hotline Miami donde les gusta pensar como matar a todos antes de entrar y empezar combates freneticos cuando el plan cambia ligeramente

author: {'steamid': '76561198047903521', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1589964911}
review:
If you love a hard but fair challenge, with some brutal music combined with tons of gore and explosion, BUTCHER is the game for you!

PROS
+ Extremely fast paced, only time it slows down is when you've killed everyone
+ Good variety of weapons and methods of killing enemies
+ Good level layout and design
+ Short but sweet campaign, doesn't overstay and doesn't feel to short

CONS
- Aside from Achievements, there is nothing to do post-game. No extra modes or Co-Op to fluff around in

*On Steam I briefly played it, but on PS4 I have completed it. I can assure you they play perfectly on either device

author: {'steamid': '76561198004155257', 'num_games_owned': 955, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1575335532}
review: This game is great, feels acrobatic in gunkata, exudes brutality in its pixel hell of blood and guts. I have not finished the game yet but I am enjoying everything about it. Hardmode is fast and furious enough for me but I can see myself dabbling in the escalated difficulty options. One critique I have is that levels should be 20% longer since most feel like they end right when you're at the height of the action. You'll have a couple nice gunfights to a big shootout and be greatest by an Exit Door after, when I feel there is room for a final stand by the opposition to stop you from getting to the Exit Door.  This cooling down of the hot heated action just pulled me out of the world and made me realize that this is a game. I think maintaining the action element is important for staying immersed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042170022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1482942943}
review:
I wish I could like this game. It seems pretty cool conceptually and I don't mind a good challenge. The music is KICKASS and the art is of a style I appreciate.

Sadly, it's not a "difficult" game. It's masochist bait. As another reviewer put it: "It's like extra hot hot sauce, the joy isn't in the flavor (or burn) it's in the proving that you can handle it."

If you are the sort of person who really liked those "impossible difficulty" Flash games from the 2000's, this is the game for you. Otherwise? Give it a miss unless you wanna pick it up for the fantastic soundtrack.

I just hope Carrion isn't being made with the same thing in mind. It'd be a shame, because there aren't enough good "you are the villain" games that actually commit to the concept in more than mere theme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037024033', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1572790895}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995167139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1558220595}
review:
This isn't a bad game, I enjoyed the challenge. It was tough enough to where I wanted to keep coming back to it, and even more impressive is that even after you die, (and you will die a lot) you can't memorize the movements or shots of your opponents. Movement is critical in this game. 
That being said, once you beat it, I was wanting more. There is speed run for those who are interested in that, and achievements, if those interest you. The community is rather dead in terms of making good levels. The workshop only had a few. 

All in all, 7/10. I had fun with this game and do not regret my purchase. Thank you Phobia Game Studio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093603927', 'num_games_owned': 2139, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1572294505}
review:
Ok, to clarify any confusion in this review: I SUCK AT THIS GAME. I can't complete a single level without dying and I'm playing the easiest difficulty (which is 'hard').
That said, this game is sadistic and brutal in it's gameplay as much as it is towards the hapless player getting slaughtered. As much as I want to complain about that, it's the whole point of the game. There's no 'life counter' and other than starting again, there's no downside to dying as you just start as another drone (i assume)
Buckets of blood, guts and gore, a chainsaw as a backup weapon and frankly a punishing and unforgiving level of accuracy required at all times...
Yes, I recommend it. But that doesn't mean I have to like it haha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021422660', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1628440832}
review:
[h1] Очень жёсткий боевик, который мог бы быть эффектным, но насквозь пиксельный и без русского перевода [/h1]

Даже жестокость в этих пикселях можно только дофантазировать. И то большинство из-за душераздирающих криков. Было в игре и нечто похожее на ягуара или гепарда в джунглях, или даже львицы, которая истошно орёт женским голосом. Так что не для слабонервных... Это мне даже напомнило немного фильм с Натали Портман про двойника её мужа. Там чудовище орало криком убитой женщины.

На самом деле здесь побольше недостатков. Например графика здесь хоть и пиксельная, но при этом очень мелкая... На маленьком экране изображение практически не видно в этом месиве. На крупном экране пиксели начинают резать глаз. Даже текст здесь пикселявый донельзя... Так что стиль изображения здесь слишком устаревший.
Мне это напомнило древнюю игрушку для DOS - Abuse. Там тоже был такой же драйв по расстрелу супостатов, но более динамичный и не такой сложный. Можете на ютубе посмотреть. Игровой процесс практически один в один. Но тогда было много таких игр, когда управление на WASD, а прицел на мышке. Но тут ещё есть тонкость.. Есть игры, где прицел фиксированный и перемещения героя на местоположение прицела не влияют - это удобно, не нужно судорожно возить мышью для поимки врагов в прицел. Но есть как здесь - прицел перемещается вместе с героем и из-за это целиться не очень удобно, порой прицел проскакивает мимо врага. Частично этот просчёт компенсируется автоприцелом с контроллера. Так что с контроллера даже удобнее. Это одна из проблем, когда с клавомышью мучений больше... 

Следующая проблема опять же в слишком мелкой пиксельной графике. По отношению к экрану все персонажи начинают сливаться в одну массу и ничего не разобрать порой. Глобально, конечно же эффектно. Но разглядывать детали больно глазам... Где-то что-то перемещается, всполохи пламени, снизу лава... И в этом всём разнообразии где-то мельтешат персонажи. Очень трудно разглядеть.

Игровой процесс похож на двумерный дум и аудиосостовляющая настраивает на нужный лад. Здесь крики раздаются тут и там, притом душераздирающие. Сразу понятно, что здесь не на отдых пришли. Переигрывать уровень придётся часто.

Так что вот такие особенности у игры, которая могла бы быть прорывной, но её хватает до очередного наскучивания. Мне лично нравится подобный стиль, но оформление под ретро опять портит всё удовольствие. Вспомнить ещё хотя бы Doom Troopers на SEGA MD2 (Genesis) - там тоже была жестокость, но пиксели были оправданы слабостью консоли. Там даже персонажи были крупными. Здесь же 20 лет спустя видим мельтешение каких-то сборищ пикселей... Надеюсь, ретроманы будут довольны... Может разрешение поменьше частично компенсирует мелкую графику, но не экспериментировал.

В результате, совет играть только на большом экране и то если поклонники таких пиксельных боевиков, автопереключения оружия, мигание экрана при маленьком здоровье и прочую дичь лучше отключить. Насчёт управления не могу сказать - с клавомыши и контроллера играется 50 на 50, минусов и плюсов примерно поровну. В плане стимовских фич всё в полном порядке - карточки, облака, стимось, контроллер, достижения - всё на месте. Но русский перевод всё же нужен. Тут достаточно текста.

[spoiler] Возможно я бы ещё заценил эту игру в виде бескомпромиссной экранизации с праводоподобным ултранасилием и выживанием в агрессивной среде, где одна паскуда по сути линчует других мразей как в жестокой среде бетонных джунглей, так и в джунглях тропических на неизвестных планетах. А смотреть пиксели - такое себе удовольствие, хоть крики здесь порой душераздирающие... [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198041165175', 'num_games_owned': 1769, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1572408706}
review: The action-filled 2D sidescrolling gunplay of Butcher is a blast and provides an enjoyable yet challenging time. The essential skills that the game relies upon are quick reflexes, good hand-eye coordination, and level awareness. Basically, you are repeating levels multiple times in order to memorize them and master your movement. This constant restarting of levels never becomes unpleasant since the challenge is well balanced and the compact level design always makes it feel fair. Plus, blowing away enemies into pools of blood and internal organs with the different weapons, particularly the shotgun, feels awesome. In addition, the low bit aesthetic really gives the title a neat old-school look. Overall, slaughtering soldiers across five different rugged 2D environments provides a satisfying, visceral, and gameplay centric experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099556024', 'num_games_owned': 2065, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1571684432}
review:
Los mapas son similares a una granja de hormigas, capas y capas, una encima de la otra sin sentido ni conocimientos de diseño de nivel mínimos. Mayoría han sido el resultado de vagancia y poca experiencia, es como si hubieran diseñado arrastrando el ratón por la pantalla. Si le sumamos la mala dirección artística, que no nos permite distinguir lo que ocurre en pantalla (armamento equipado, clases de enemigos, protagonista, etc.), se crea una dificultad artificial consecuencia de una gran confusión terminando así en una experiencia desagradable. Por si fuera poco la duración es escasa y a pesar de ello consigue alcanzar la monotonía artística y jugable, poco contenido mal llevado a cabo.

En definitiva, BUTCHER es un proyecto en un estado de desarrollo muy lejano al juego terminado que se vendería a su precio. Por ello, solo recomiendo su compra a fanáticos que amen con todo su corazón la sangre dibujada en pixelart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093262568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1569822211}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091558361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1571607152}
review:
I got this game believing I would be getting a game where I could play as basically the Terminator. Instead of feeling like a bad@$$ killing machine however I instead felt more like a flimsy and pathetic machine that wouldn't even be good for 'non killing assignment'! Not to mention you can barely make out what is going on the screen, so even if the game had a better murder system in place you still wouldn't be able to truly enjoy thatoh so sweet post-apocalyptic bloodshed. I mean, is it just me or does this not feel it should have been the easiest game to make ever.

Who knows, maybe someday I can crush human skulls under my cold metal foot as I extinguish them from history? Some day... But not today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019209539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1567113740}
review:
It's not a bad game, but it's also not one I really enjoyed. 

I suspected at first it was because I was just bad at it, moving, aiming, shooting, dodging, and all the other stuff all at once is kinda hard to start with, and that's just the base gameplay. Of course it's meant to be difficult, it's just one of those those types of games... It's like extra hot hot sauce, the joy isn't in the flavor (or burn) it's in the proving that you can handle it. 

If you were good at it, the game is actually really short, it's only got a couple of levels and hardly any story. Apparently you're playing as a cyborg out to destroy humanity. But I never got any sense on how it would complete that goal, since even basic enemies prove a major threat and you're only killing humans by the dozens... really they are breeding faster than you're killing them.

So what's my point? I dunno. Apparently you don't need to have one. 

Anyway, the atmosphere is good, the gore effects are nice, and the setting is... interesting? Intriguing. It sometimes made me wonder who these people are and what they are doing before I came in and killed them. Which is a double edged sword, it's good to encourage the feeling of an expansive world... but when it goes along with the question "Just what the hell am I doing?" it leaves a bit to be desired. 

I got it as part of a humble bundle. It's not something I would spend money on, but if you like classic shooters (I think people compare it to doom), you don't mind a skimpy story, and are an absolute boss who drinks hot sauce straight from the bottle, I can see this being a game you would enjoy. 

edit: Apparently there is a W.I.M.P. mode. That's nice of them, I approve of the gesture and the tongue in cheek attitude. I'm sure it would make visiting their world a little less frustrating. But then again, it's only frustrating if you're denied something you want... the game never really gave me a reason to care whether the cyborg killed everyone or not. The presence of easy mode raises my opinion of the game, but not enough to tip it into a 'buy'.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970938346', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 558, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1661060557}
review:
The format of the game should be fun to play, but the execution is so poor that it ruins it.

It is quite difficult to see anything and to perform basic interaction. I can barely even see my crosshairs.

I watched this game from early on, and bought it in a bundle though I had my eye on it for some time. I feel like I dodged a major bullet here by getting it at a low price. I would have felt badly stung at anything more than a dollar.

I wanted to like this game so badly, but I find it unplayable. Don't get me wrong, I love hard shooters and have beaten every Serious Sam game on Serious, so it isn't a matter of being too hard. I can't play this darn thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065542223', 'num_games_owned': 1533, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1570225966}
review:
Butcher es un juego que me recuerda mucho a Hotline Miami. Rápido, visceral, los enemigos son muy débiles con poca HP pero te pueden hacer pedazos en un segundo. Aquí cargas con un arsenal intercambiable en lugar de tirar y recoger armas. Lo que me desagrada es que aunque reinicias un nivel al morir como en HLM aquí hay muchos mas tiempos de espera. "activo este switch aquí, espero por la puerta" "mato a estos enemigos y espero 3 segundos a que salgan nuevos" en HLM cuando reinicias ya sabes que X o Y enemigos estan en tal lado y rusheas hacia la sección donde te mataron la ultima vez, aquí no es así. 

Al final, le doy mi recomendación a este juego. mas no le daré mas mi tiempo. compra en oferta y diviertete por un tiempo razonable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042369906', 'num_games_owned': 1491, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1605567102}
review:
This game is very hard...  It will make you frustrated...  It sure frustrated me when I first started playing it.  But let me tell you, at some point you will hit a flow state of pure carnage in which you feel like the GOD OF DEATH!

If you enjoyed the fast paced trial and error gameplay of Hotline Miami there is a chance you will like this game.  It's not a one to one comparison, but I could feel this game stroking the same areas of my brain.  Another game that comes to mind is Brigador: Up Armoured Edition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005059568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1600433142}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091708666', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1697288476}
review:
Tuhle hru jsem vyhrál, takže jsem nevěděl co od toho čekat. 
I když jsem měl nahráno asi jenom pár hodin, tak mě hra velmi nadchla jakožto milovníka oldschool her.

Je to taková PixelArt DOOM 2D střílečka se spousto krve a brutality....
Ta hra se s nikým nemaže a dává ti pravou chuť výzvy a pocitu uspokojení, když dokončíš level a to se mi líbí.

JAKO KDYBY JSTE MĚLI S DÉMONEM DVOJDOMEK.
Vřele doporučuji pro ty, kdo hledají pravou chuť výzvy!!

Velmi mě taky rozesmálo, když sem si pausnul hru a tam bylo napsáno: "REAL MEN DONT PAUSE" :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198094803808', 'num_games_owned': 4070, 'num_reviews': 5384, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1568996537}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048976349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1568863118}
review:
Game does a great job injecting the feel of 90s FPS games like Quake into a 2D game. Music and sound effects are top notch and had me pumped up like Quake II did when I first played it. It's not wall-punchingly hard on the standard mode but if you have trouble they have a nice "easy" mode dlc free of charge so anyone can enjoy the game. One thing I don't like is the spawning of enemies and items are the same little electric animation, so you'll likely waste ammo on powerups that spawn instead of enemies. My controller (logitech) was somewhat unresponsive sometimes for this game only, not sure if it's an actual issue or my controller just didn't like this game.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036699013', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1573114253}
review: A purely skill based game without leveling or any kind of grinding. I really like it. The game is a little hard to read visually. In a fast paced action game it's important to quickly recognize where the enemies are, what type they are, what platforms you and the enemies can shoot through etc. This doesn't ruin the game but it could have been better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974684590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1570188232}
review:
Not easy to believe, but this game IS hard! ...even on the easiest mode (which is "hard").
It takes a while to survive a level. And then you realize, that you have missed a secret. So you have to be tolerant to frustration.
But even since its nice and pixeled, the mess you can do is wonderfull. A sh!tload of blood here, a sh!tload of guts there... <3

I just see, that there is a 'little whiny baby-mode' via free DLC. Maybe I will try it when frustration takes overhand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003834051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1572122832}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1570718743}
review:
Too visually muddled for me personally but I see this being popular with anyone who played lots of those Flash sidescrollers back in the day. 

If the game was more accessible difficulty wise the visuals wouldn't matter as much cause you could crank it down a notch to make up for some visual confusion but I don't think that for the average person just browsing action games that they will like this much. 

I will be revisiting this at a later time to re-evaluate my opinions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004011791', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1570871449}
review:
This game is brutal and awesome! This is a 2D difficult platformer, and i never got frustrated/raged (not even once) entire playthrough! Even when i took 10+ tries to beat a level. That is actually fucking amazing.

Only 2 cons:
1. There is a bug when you try to drop down a platform tilted at 45 degrees by repeatedly tapping the S button, your character jerks vertically up-and-down repeatedly instead of just dropping down.

2. NOT ENOUGH HEAVY METAL! The final boss is literally a [spoiler] Giant Metal-Spiked Construct [/spoiler] and the accompanying music isn't metal? C'MON MAN! That's a complete waste :(

Looking forward to CARRION ! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198027814305', 'num_games_owned': 3500, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1568033371}
review:
Decent small game with big potentional 

Visual presentation is great but sometimes its too hard to keep track which of those soldiers running on screen are you
in hectic firefights
Movement and controlls are ok
You can do lot of tricks like bunny hopping, grenade/rocket jumps or shotgun speed boost to jumps what gives this game potential to be interesting for speedrunners as it allows bypass portions of levels
Enemies variety are ok but on small enemies you usaly do not have time to figure what weapon they are holding (so you junmp to their face with shotgun to be met with flamethrower sometimes ;3) Yes if they are idle or in chase mode you can see from different moving speed and weapon model but this game is fast most of the time 
Gore is fantastic, even though its few pixels, its more brutal than most AAA games ;3

It comes with built in level editor and with some user scripting you can create or recreate lot of stuff /different weapons, puzzless or maybe even different games/

Ahh and You are evil and you are going to kill everyone on earth, if you do not like that I guess not game for you 

Otherwise THumbs up ;3

author: {'steamid': '76561197999935168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1190, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1625626029}
review:
Some of these little pixel games are really cool and this one is no exception. It looks great, sounds great, and plays great. There's lots of violence but no big knockered women which is unfortunate. The level layout and enemy placement/spawns are surprisingly well thought out. The game is pretty challenging too. There are 3 difficulty levels: hard, very hard, then super hard or whatever it's called. It is tough enough on just 'hard' and I have no plans on trying the other difficulties. Plus the game is extra fun when you pretend you are a rational moderate conservative and the enemies are all Hollywood liberals and CNN news anchors. If murder were legal, this game would be an accurate representation of what my time in California would look like.

8/10 very good. Oh and the music is slammin also.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973744917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1567285111}
review:
Fun shooter, took me around 2 hours to complete the main story. Old school aesthetic, fun weapons, simple keyboard controls, fast-paced combat and fun pixel gore make for a great time. 

That being said, the small pixel characters (your own and enemies) are sometimes difficult to see. Especially when there is a lot going on screen. Also, for game that calls itself "Hard", it does a lot of cheap deaths that force you to play through a particular section a second time. For example, in the trailer it shows two walls coming together to crush the player, in that instance you need to push 3 buttons in the correct order to proceed otherwise you die. Usually this will kill a player the first time since the walls move in pretty quickly and the player does not always notice the buttons, let alone know the proper combination.

 Moments like this cheapen the "hard" theme that the game is going for. It feels like the game added these cheap moments just to artificially increase the playtime, rather than create compelling gameplay. The game is hard because it is trying to make up for the fact that it is short. Playing the game on easy mode would drastically decrease it's playtime.

That being said, if you are into 2d platform shooters like Soldat than this game is for you. Otherwise it's difficulty might chase you away.

review: J'étais pas prêt pour tant de violence. Le massacre, le gore pixélisé qui dégouline sur mon écran, tronçonner des innocents en panique avec un arsenal restreint mais efficace... Et puis ensuite la difficulté du jeu, qui là aussi m'a sévèrement violenté, c'est moi qui pleurait des larmes de sang: Beaucoup de niveau hard de chez hard, il faut être vif, plus que vif même il faut voir dans le futur pour s'en sortir vivant. J'ai adoré l'expérience.

review:
Amazing game, literally speaks volumes of difficulty of what games should be. Love the constant dark vibe this game gives off on top of creating a bloody mess throughout the entire game. The pure edge has a certain caliber to it as well as the character you play being a terminator like being sent to destroy earth in the most violent and efficient ways. The story is driven by visuals around the player and completely fits a doom aesthetic.

Highly recommend this game for those looking for challenge, and also want to murder literally everything in their path. This game certainly takes patience but is well deserving a playthrough. 

~poofoo5

author: {'steamid': '76561198043765841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1561772435}
review:
People oft compare BUTCHER to DOOM but a more apt comparison would be Hotline Miami meets Mario meets Lemmings.

You're running, jumping, shooting and hoping to criminy that the tiny specks shooting back at you miss because, for a killer robot, you're pretty heckin' vulnerable to even small arms fire. And you better bloody believe that this game loves shoving you right into the middle of a smorgasbord of carnage, mayhem and geometry that is as equally lethal to those around you as it is yourself.

Expect to kill a lot. Expect to die a lot. Expect to get stuck in a semi-addictive loop of "next run will be perfect, I got it this time" a lot (ala the earlier mentioned Hotline Miami).

Art and sound direction is on point. Delightfully thrash-y and impacting, dripping with gore just the same as the gameplay itself.

Controls well with mouse aiming and numerical keys switching your weapons, though I can't imagine playing this with a controller.

I just wish the graphics were more huge so I could better appreciate the guts I'm ripping and tearing here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073467397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1582866847}
review:
Первый Quake и Hotline Miami насилуют друг друга и на свет порождается Butcher - мрачный, жестокий, хардкорный шутер с видом сбоку. Да, при невзрачной обёртке эта игра на самом деле поражает деталями. Раненые враги, упав наземь, ещё шевелятся и что то ноют, солдаты с реактивными ранцами при смерти взрываются, убивая своих (Или нас, если неудачно встали в момент их гибели), да даже просто бич, упавший из за нас в лаву, поднимет всплеск, что может нам навредить, а что сказать о возможности пинать врагов и даже насаживать их на крюки, висящие на уровне. 
А враги? Врагов много и они все опасны. От безобидных гражданских и солдат с дробовиками, винтовками, до всяких роботов и полицейских фургончиков. Особенно запомнились какие то зёбики, что бросаются на тебя в рукопашную, которых я ещё почему то окрестил "Азиатами из гачи". А умирать придётся часто, ибо мы сами не шибко живучи, полагаться надо на быстроту действий и реакцию. Притом изначальная кампания накидывает новых условий. Тут тебе и огромные дисковые пилы с паучьими ногами, и водоёмы с пираньями, и просто всякое дерьмо, в котором и самому помереть, и врагов закинуть.
С оружием тоже полный порядок. Всё по старинке, только БФГ не завезли, да и ракетомёт заменили гранатомётом. Но и пустяк, главное что всё оружие достойно сбалансировано, и в любом уровне вы найдёте момент, когда можно воспользоваться дробовиком, а когда стоит доставать рейлган, а когда поможет только автомат. Печалит, правда, что патронов протагонист с собой мало таскает, но компенсируется тем, что их достаточно много попадается и так.
Про музыку я ничего не смогу сказать, что то во мне перемкнуло, и я пробежал кампанию под треки из первого и второго Red Alert (Кстати, очень подходит).
А, и минусы. Порой как то слишком хардкорно, на финальном боссе жопа сгорела прост. И секреты, которые в большинстве случаев ничего не дают, кроме ачивок.
8\10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060519527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1709140479}
review:
This is a well-made game.  I bounced off it the first time I played because the setting is so grim and the game is so punishing, but after a few more starts the gameplay and art won me over.  Both individual missions and the game as a whole have good lengths, neither too long nor too short.  I would recommend this to people who enjoyed Hotline Miami, but I recommend turning off the in-game music and listening to your own House music instead; the music in this game sets the tone well enough but wasn't as good as the music in Hotline Miami at keeping me "in the zone" instead of rage-quitting.

One good design decision is having the ammo dropped by enemies disappear fairly quickly, which forces the player to be a lot more aggressive, which makes the game more exciting.

I'm looking forward to the next game by these developers.

NEGATIVE
Game is short, dont get my wrong its absolute okay for the price, there is not problem at all, but game is so good i really want more content even for another money :/
*Weapon switching roll over again from 1to6 is bad idea atleast for me, i mean better system will be 1to6 and 6to1 back. Died a lot on boss because i cant simple fast switch weapon enough what i want (i miss the weapon what i want, just roll over)  So i must switch weapon on keyboard in fight.
*You will die a lost on boss because system platform. Level design is not bad, but its not good either here, butcher simple cant jump properly fast on shorter platform and with weapon switching boss was really pain in the ass :D

CONSTITUTION
People saying...
GAME IS TOO HARD - From start yes, but if you play smart and sometime repeat levels, you realize game is not to hard like seems from start.
IF YOU DIE YOU PLAY HOLE LEVEL FROM START AND THERE IS NO CHECKPOINT - ... this make me smile, because LEVELS ARE SHORT and THERE IS NO NEED CHECKPOINT.  Repeat level take a few minutes and i mean really there is no problem repeat level its is always fun and make progress.

I AM CASUAL PLAYER NOT HARDCORE

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1549173035}
review:
[b][i]Review copy provided by developer[/i][/b]

You ever end up liking something more than you’re supposed to? You know what I mean… laughing at an off-color joke, choosing garbage fast food over something better, or watching all three seasons of Drawn Together. It happened to me while playing BUTCHER, specifically after shotgunning a guard literally in half and wrapping his intestines around a catwalk. Or maybe it was when I started chainsawing an entire room of civilians, scaring the survivors into leaping onto punji sticks rather than face my wrath. Or it could have been when I blew someone’s torso into the ceiling and it got stuck on a meathook, showering the room with blood as it swung back and forth. Honestly I have so many good memories of playing this thing, it’s hard to pick just one to feel bad about.

Welcome back to the apocalypse, except this time you’re on the winning side! A sociopathic AI has gone full Skynet, devastating the surface of the Earth and mopping up the remains with custom-built killbots. You happen to be the newest one off the assembly line, charged with taking out the final pockets of human resistance on this ruined world. Operating out of the shell of a destroyed space station, you teleport down to arms factories and jungle encampments to massacre anyone foolish enough to be caught alive, using an array of vicious firearms and explosives. But humanity will not go quietly into that dark night, and they will fight back with just as many guns and bombs and trained attack animals and automated sawblade traps as they can muster.

It’s a grim premise for a game, and I assure you the developers went absolutely pitch-black with the execution. The color palette for the game is incredibly muted except for crimson blood and glowing lava, giving BUTCHER an appropriately charnel house atmosphere. Pixel art obscures much of the detail but your victims scream and gurgle when downed, begging incoherently to be put out of their misery. Limbs and viscera will fly in every level, because encounters are specifically designed to see foes chucked into meat grinders, hung from hooks, crushed by pistons, and devoured by piranhas and panthers. There is no humor to be found here except in the gob-smacking spectacle of painting an entire room red in the blood of your foes, before rolling on to the next massacre.

Assuming you’re as terrible a person as I and haven’t lost your appetite for BUTCHER, the action is a pretty full course. Each of the game’s five areas have four levels each, smallish maps designed to be beaten in a matter of minutes. There’s usually some gimmick to each, like a long elevator ride or outrunning a sawblade or swimming through subterranean tunnels, but the focus is on big bullet brawls with the scraps of humanity. Almost every level has a few arenas where enemies spawn in along with ammo, health, and armor to keep you going in your bloody fugue. You’ll score six weapons as you progress, mostly standard weapons like a shotgun, rifle, flamethrower, and grenade launcher, and always with a room custom-made to show you how much havoc you can wreak with it.

The only limiting factor to BUTCHER is its difficulty, which is a badge the developers wear proudly with the “easiest” difficulty being Hard. That’s no longer entirely true, there’s a proper Easy mode that the game will endlessly ridicule you for choosing, but this all should give you some idea of where the game’s priorities are. I usually avoid games that are hard for the sake of being hard but that’s not the case here, BUTCHER’s challenges are entirely tests of skill and entirely fair, if frustrating at times. Enemies do tons of damage so you can never let your guard down, and victory is a matter of icing foes with the tight keyboard and mouse controls before they can get a shot off, and dodging anything that gets through. Levels have no checkpoints either, which means you might be running through some arenas multiple times if the back half of a level is giving you trouble.

As long as you’re aware of that, and just how absurdly grim the game is, you’re bound to have a blast fighting the bad fight here. BUTCHER revels in its gore and chaos, full of big brawls and levels with plenty of hooks and pits to enhance the horror. There are secret skulls you can hunt if you’re the explorer type, several higher difficulties if you’re the masochistic type, and even a level editor and Steam Workshop support for full sadists. It looks, sounds, and feels the part of an ultra-violent Terminator joint, and if that sounds like your jam then don’t delay in embracing the darkness. I won’t even tell anyone how much you like it.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016026827', 'num_games_owned': 1974, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1548879345}
review:
[b]7/10[/b]
[b][i]"DOOM and QUAKE made a 2D bastard."[/i][/b]
Butcher is a very tough and fast pixel sidescroll jump'n'gun. And totally feels like the 2D[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1640055402] bastard son[/url] of [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/2280/Ultimate_Doom/]DOOM[/url] and [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/2320/QUAKE_II/]QUAKE2[/url], who was born in the early '90s. I love the setting and the idea! But be warned the game is very short and the gameplay could be way more diversified. Also the difficulty is kinda heavy, which therfor creates the replay value of this game. There is also an easy mode ([url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/555420/BUTCHER__WIMP_EASY_MODE_DLC/?curator_clanid=26094784]W.I.M.P.[/url]) - which feels too easy. Bottom line, it makes fun but a bit of complexity and depth wouldn't have harmed the Butcher.

[u]Pros:[/u]
+ great pixel blood gore
+ very good controls
+ good (nostalgic) atmosphere
+ good pixel visuals 
+ good music & sounds
+ steam workshop

[u]Cons:[/u]
- short levels
- only 21 levels
- no normal difficulty
- easy is too easy
- hard is almost too hard
- too few maps at the workshop

[u]Verdict:[/u]
[b]Good pastime for every child of the '80s/'90s.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198091771221', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1657580233}
review:
[h1]A Useless Weeb Reviews: BUTCHER[/h1]
Where do i even start...This game is amazing. A callback to classic fast-paced shooters like QUAKE with an incredible difficulty, this game presents itself as a gritty, hardcore shoot-em-up.

But does the appearance it presents and claims of incredible difficulty hold true?

[h1]JUICE RATING[/h1]

🍹 🍹 🍹 🍹 🍹
BUTCHER is a master of grabbing attention. With it's amazing soundtrack, powerful sound design, and tense gameplay.
There are few moments where you are not actively engaged or slaughtering your foes.

The Gameplay is rock solid, promoting familiar WASD movement with mouse aiming on a 2D playing field. This coupled with the amazing map design enables strategic application to what would normally be a simple run-&-gun, promoting you to think about your next move. The dangerous enemy variety keeps you on your toes, and a large number of secrets enable you to uncover hidden collectibles.

The Sounds are top-notch, both direct and ambient. From the powerful blasts of a shotgun to roaring fires, it's easy to tell what's happening just by listening. The music pairs with this to create a truly unique experience, making each game an energetic, jam-packed festival of death.

The Maps are fine-tuned to be both elaborate & diverse, but also balanced and strategic. A simple platform can be the difference between taking a hit or killing your foe, and physical terrain can provide necessary cover to avoid incoming fire. At least from "most" enemies.

Weapon design allows you to strategically plan your engagements and react accordingly to a situation. Taking your shotgun to close-range foes or sniping enemies at long-range with the assault rifle, the weapons--while small in number--are powerful and effective.

In addition, the game comes with many achievements and challenges to overcome which adds a ton of replayability. Try to collect all of the hidden skulls, or perhaps test your mettle in the speedrunning challenge! If you are truly daring, give "Impossible" difficulty a try. I guarantee you will die, a LOT.

TL:DR BUTCHER provides a healthy and exhilarating combination of gameplay, sound design, and replayability that is sure to take up a good chunk of your free time. Definitely a title worth engaging in for what it has to offer you.

[h1]DIFFICULTY RATING[/h1]

💀 💀 💀 to 💀 💀 💀 💀 💀
BUTCHER claims to provide the easiest difficulty on HARD. Does the game stand up to this claim? Yes. Yes it does.
With it's deadly variety of enemies and hazardous environments, the reckless be wary on their quest to exterminate humanity.

BUTCHER, to a casual player would likely come off as much too difficult to be fun. However, the games difficulty is far from punishing. While enemies can deal a large amount of damage to the reckless, strategic movement and use of equipment will render even the strongest enemy a pushover. However, the game is far from easy either--with dozens of surprises and traps waiting for the unwary, in addition to sudden ambushes. Trial and Error will be a factor commonly seen here, but greatly rewarded the determined will be.

The game offers three main difficulties, with a fourth unlockable.

HARD will introduce you to the game quite easily, while HARDER will provide a more "normal" experience as you take more damage but still retain health and ammo pickups. THE HARDEST is how the game SHOULD be played, but at least experience HARD and HARDER first.

For the hardcore--or masochistic--The fourth unlockable difficulty will prove if you've got the capability to really handle the heat. Providing a difficulty that is borderline punishing, but incredibly rewarding and satisfactory if you beat it.

The difficulty makes up the claims the game creates and holds them tightly, this is a difficult experience, and one worth enduring.

TL:DR BUTCHER is hard, really hard. But very thrilling and rewarding to overcome.

[h1]DIVERSITY RATING[/h1]

🎲 🎲
Alas, BUTCHER is not an incredibly diverse title. The levels are linear and do not have any truly differing routes. You'll always go down the same pathways and obtain the same gear, fight the same enemies. The only differing factor is that enemy spawns can be slightly different to spice it up.

This lack of diversity in the gameplay can reduce the replayability for some, but it also makes learning and overcoming the greater difficulties easier. Enabling you to always expect the same group of opponents in a fight, thus letting you learn and prioritize certain kills over others to overcome a battle, or allowing you to avoid death via a trap the next time around.

Thankfully, an in-game level editor allows the ability to construct your own levels, and play other player-created levels at your leisure, which gives the game a hearty boost to it's replayability. Try making and uploading your own! There's an achievement for that y'know~

Unfortunately, there is little else the game can give you in diversity. The game--in and of its own nature--is linear, and sooner or later you are bound to reach a dead end with no new content to see. But that's a road yet to be travelled.

TL:DR BUTCHER is linear, not very diverse. But the game has -enough- diversity to keep you going for a while.

BUTCHER is a hearty callback to the olden days of rocking shoot-em-ups, carrying with it the heart of the 90s and the spirit of QUAKE, it's a title any fan of the shooter genre should pick up--not to mention a challenge worth overcoming for those daring completionists! If you like thrills, love guns, and want a TON of gore...Take up BUTCHER and exterminate humanity!

author: {'steamid': '76561198246254490', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1623406467}
review:
When I first found out about this game, I heard about how "the easiest difficulty is 'Hard'". As usual, I was interested in the challenge that this game would offer me, and I found out about how brutally challenging the game was upon getting killed over and over again on "Hard" difficulty.

After completing "Hard" difficulty, I proceeded to complete the other difficulties, being "Harder" difficulty[spoiler] - which sets your max HP at 66.6% -[/spoiler] and "The Hardest" difficulty[spoiler] - same as "Harder" difficulty, but completely removes armor and health pickups[/spoiler]. Afterwards, I unlocked "Impossible" difficulty [spoiler] by collecting 20 skulls [/spoiler] which makes this game one of the hardest games I have ever played[spoiler] by taking "The Hardest" difficulty and setting the max HP to 33.3%, making all damage take away at least 1/3 of my health, if not kill me instantly[/spoiler].

I also noticed people referring to this game as "2D Doom", which is easily noticeable, considering the challenge and ultra-violence in both games. Despite this, BUTCHER is still a unique game in it's own way, with different mechanics and more ways to eviscerate everything and everyone that stands in your way.

All in all, this is one hell of a challenging game, and if you are used to dying a lot in games, give this one a try.

난이도 진짜 찌발..............같은 구간에서 한 50번 정도 뒈지면 나무관세음 보살
절로 부처님 찾게된다.

둠과 같은 육사시미 초꼬추랑 곱창 막창 비쥬얼과 말초신경 끝자락에 부싳돌로 불붙이는 자극 터지는 감각적 브금.
끼얏호~ 하고 탄성이 절러 튀어나오는 잦같은 박부장 뚝배기를 쏴 꺠부수는 짜릿하고 시원시원한 타격감. 
엄청 잘만든 게임인데 난이도가 진짜 부처님 자비를 절로 구걸하게 만든다.

다행이도 창작마당 모드에서 이지 모드를 다운받을수 있어서 엔딩은 봤다.

조만간 마음에 평정이 다시 찾아오면 보리수 아래서 깨달음을 얻은 부처님의 마음으로 하드코어 모드에 도전해 볼까 한다.
그게 언가 될질 모르겠다.

review: This game is not for everyone. It requires sharp reflexes and a lot of patience, depending on skill. Hell, the game will probably improve your aiming reflexes and precision in other games as well, if you're not used to this sort of thing.
