author: {'steamid': '76561198868106788', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1630590664}
review:
[h1]BUTCHER[/h1] is a fast-paced and hard as nails action platformer for those who are a fan of the grit and gore of games from before it like [b]Abuse[/b], [b]Quake[/b], and [b]DOOM[/b] and it even echos the intense nihilistic vibes of games like [b]Quarantine[/b] or [b]POSTAL[/b]. It has a very [i]"Fuck you!"[/i] 90's attitude to go with it all and it's just as violent as the previous games mentioned. So if that isn't your thing you might want to go back to Mario or something.

The graphics aim to achieve a lo-fi retro indie aesthetic, mimicking something you might have seen on the Amiga or perhaps a very early MS-DOS game. The atmosphere is as industrial and oppressive as its soundtrack, bringing to mind the music of  acts like [b]Nine Inch Nails[/b] or [b]Hocico[/b] as it thumps away to your own orchestra of pounding gun fire and the wailing screams of your victims. All in all it delivers a very visceral and tightly put together little package on the presentation front.

Gameplay consists of short but tough levels that you go through like most side-scrollers or platformers, most often ending in rooms that will spawn in waves for you to deal with before letting you reach an exit. Sometimes a level will have a gimmick like a giant saw-blade spider you have to out run or lava flooding a level that you have to out jump onto platforms. If you die, you restart the whole level. There is no mercy bestowed upon the player.

There are six weapons to choose from: a chainsaw, a shotgun, a machine gun, a flamethrower, a grenade launcher, and a railgun (all of which your enemy can use too). Along with varying health and armor pickups that you can stack pretty high. The only other thing to collect is secret skulls that, upon collecting them all, will unlock something for you.

There are five zones to complete, with four levels each and a final boss at the end. Each zone has a different theme: an iron works facility, a military base, a jungle outpost, a volcano research station, and a derelict city. Each zone introduces a new enemy type and weapon.

Basically, this is a love letter to the games of yore that oozed a sharp nihilistic aesthetic covered in rust, steel, gore and lava. The tunes are menacing, the guns are loud, the screams are anguished, and the game wants to kill you over and over again and challenge your ego as well as your reflexes. It's a very straight forward popcorn action platformer in a very tightly put together package with a focused art direction and game design. It has great controller support and even includes a level editor.

If that sounds right up your ally, I can wholeheartedly recommend [b]BUTCHER[/b] to you.

EDIT: I should quickly mention that if you plan on getting the skulls, expect some to be a serious pain in the ass to acquire...

author: {'steamid': '76561198395204559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1593285506}
review:
Хардкорное рубилово в 2D!
Рассмотрим Плюсы ,Минусы и особенности.
Плюсы:
1.Удобное управление(Оптимальное и простое)
2.Малые системные требования(Пойдёт на бабушкиной печке)
3.Атмосфера(Жуткие коридоры космической станции,базы и т.п.)
4.Музыка(Звучит не плохо,Брутально)
5.Мастерская(Можно скачать парочку неплохих уровней)
6.Мясо(Для пиксельного Шутер-Платформера сделано хорошо)
Особенности:
1.Стиль(Смесь Doom,Quake и Платформеров старых 8 бит и 16 бит консолей)
2.Хардкор!!!(Дикий,Дерзкий и Брутальный Хардкор!!!)
Минусы:
Отсутствие Русского языка(Особо не мешает,но всё же могли бы и сделать)
2.Отсутствие Кооператива (Если Мультиплеер трудно представить в этой игре,то отсутствие Кооператива очень странно,так как на игру можно будет потратить больше времени)
Итог:
Хороший Шутер-платформер на пару-тройку вечеров.
Оценка:
8 "Свежее Мясо" из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035486330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1507236521}
review: Difficult platformer with a lot of gore with an atmosphere reminding of a Predator or Alien universe. Decent pixel design. Despite a lot of death and failure, a funny experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199741006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1554060857}
review:
Мясной индиплатформер в котором вам в роли беспощадного киборга предстоит максимально насильно очистить планету от человеческой заразы. Этакий второй Quake наоборот и в двадэ.
Враги здесь кричат от боли, захлебываются собственной кровью, разбрасывают повсюду свои внутренности, попутно обильно забрызгивая всё кровищей, обилию которой позавидовал бы даже Тарантино.
Саундтрек соответствующий, т.е. мрачный и аггресивный.
Единственный, сомнительный минус - сложность игры специально завышена, так умирать будете так же часто, как и кожаные мешки.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055712441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1534699187}
review:
Butcher ist ein sehr guter 2D Shooter mit sehr viel Gore und einem richtig krassen Schwierigkeitsgrad.

Die Grafik ist ziemlich Old School gehalten, Pixel wo man nur hinsieht. Perfekt für diese Art Spiel!

Das Gameplay ist ein gewohnter 2D Shooter in dem man in verschiedenen Levelabschnitten Gegner abballern muss, kleinere Rätsel lösen muss. Das Waffenarsenal reicht von einer Kettensäge bis zu einer Railgun und aus meiner Sicht fühlen diese sich Perfekt an! Stimmt alles und das was mir auch sehr gefiehl wenn das Spiel schon Butcher heißt dann gibt es reichlich Gore und Blood.

Alles in allem finde ich Butcher sehr gut. Macht jede Menge Spaß und ist defenitiv sein Geld wert, aber Achtung der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist nicht zu unterschätzten! (Das Spiel ist hammer schwer...)

review: Butcher man, great fun game. Controls are smooth as butter. Better to play on an 8gb pc or higher though. Will lag on 4gb at times. Fun gameplay, interesting story even for the little amount of story there is. Definately recommend for people that want like an indie side scrolling, gorey shooter game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089906324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1532373563}
review: I never really gave this game a fair shot. But now that my PC has temporarily died and I'm forced to play games on a laptop that can barely run Ty The Tasmanian Tiger, I have grown to appreciate BUTCHER to a new degree. I've always thought it was a bada** game but it's actually addicting as heck. I was able to learn how to complete levels more effectively even while stoned off my a**. Playing with a controller is actually not a bad idea either! Great controls and plenty of things happening simultaneously. Runs perfectly on extremely lowend systems. Great visuals, sounds and atmosphere. Also I heard these guys are coming out with a new game called CARRION, which looks incredible. Definitely going to continue playing this game whether I'm on the go or just chilling home alone when nobody is online to play with. I strongly recommend BUTCHER.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103306049', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2071, 'last_played': 1531477892}
review:
Butcher is an action platformer which emphasises on skillful movement, timing and aim. The influences of early first-person shooters and media from the time is readily apparent both in core game mechanics and presentation. To step it a notch further, it also goes for ballsy attitude and crude humor. Although the gore system might seem as a moot selling point, the physics behind it and the way it transforms the levels really turns every kill into a visceral experience.
Level design can be described as mostly linear with occasional backtracking through switch mazes, along with either dedicated or mid-level arenas. The enemies are varied enough to require different approaches and priorities depending on the level. Thankfully there's minimal amount of PRNG invovled, mostly seen in arena spawning and enemy movement, which helps with the speedrunning aspect of the game.
The weapon roster might seem pale, but considering the unique ammo pools and need to switch them during intense fights, it fills the sweetspot of being managable. Additionally, half of the weapons can be used to enhance player movement.
Expect the inital playthrough to last about 4 hours, with some replayability coming from subsequent runs of different difficulties or goals. While Workshop support might extend replayability even further, the community for it is, unfortunately, lacking.
In short, you get a lot of bang for your buck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011288995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1688053548}
review:
Great atmosphere, tone, visual style, soundtrack, gameplay. Very intense & visceral.

Also notable is how much "fluff" it cuts out that most other games suffer from. Really just focused on a tight and immersive gameplay experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985067596', 'num_games_owned': 1378, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3621, 'last_played': 1711047590}
review: A great game bearing many similarities to classics such as Quake and Doom, both in terms of ultraviolence and sheer speed. The artstyle is stylized and interesting, although a bit murky at times. The controls are good and responsive. Good for speedrunning, with a nice interface for doing individual level times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215357745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1693659803}
review:
节奏相当快，难度特别高，一次不死直接通关平均一关也就3分钟，死亡后从本关开始重新游戏没有存档点。
确实很难，不过熟练了之后，几乎怪一出现还没开始攻击就可以秒掉，几种精锐怪虽然很难秒但他们的攻击都很容易躲，就算命中率很高弹药也经常是问题。有些关卡真的超级难打，像有一关一堆锯齿怪先是一波3个然后是6个还没有弹药补給简直了。
以前玩的时候最低难度只有困难，那时候花了两个小时打到了最终BOSS真的打不过，最近来看又多了一个免费DLC好像是加简单难度的，可以再试试

author: {'steamid': '76561197978842497', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1553452027}
review:
Butcher to dwuwymiarowy platformej utrzymany w stylistyce brutalnej kontrkultury lat 90'tych, która zrodziła Doom'a czy Quake'a. Pikselowa przemoc jest tu podkrecona do maximum przez odpowiednio abrazyjny dźwięk - wibracje ciężkich maszyn, jazgot pił mechanicznych czy utrzymane w lo-fi krzyki wrogów którzy konają zalani rozpikselowanymi flakami. Niczym w Super Meat Boy'u, Butcher rozwija się do karkołomnego tempa i zachęca do tego by znaleźć jak najlepszą taktykę do radzenia sobie z danym konfliktem, a sam proces staje się trudniejszy, wraz z rozwojem gry.
Wrogowie zaczną wyciągać wyrzutnie rakiet, a gdy zaczną Cię masowo okrążać, będziesz musiał zaostrzyć celność i poruszać się JESZCZE szybciej, aby uniknąć nadchodzących pocisków. Jeśli skończy ci się amunicja to będziesz musiał polegać na swojej pile łańcuchowej, aby dokończyć robotę. 
Co tu więcej pisać - zdecydowanie warto spróbować tego krwistego shake'a.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048630964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1544147986}

author: {'steamid': '76561198324530459', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1603627110}
review:
Butcher is a hidden gem of a game thats not like any other, seems like a regular side scrolling action game at first but it's easy to see once you start playing that this is a game that focuses of the gore, Butcher heavily gives you a sense of macabre with the screams of your enemies, the blood splattered walls, chainsaw rampages, its soundtrack, i would actually give this game a horror tag because of this. Butcher succeeds as a fast paced 2d shooter, and excels as a Gore fest. 
PS: Would totally listen to Cannibal Corpses "The bleeding" album to this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061567463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1597057528}
review:
When you create a hardcore game like The Butcher that heavily emphasizes player skill, repeated playthroughs, trial and error etc you really have to make sure that you do everything possible so that the player doesn't feel like the game is actively hindering you from succeeding. If you get it right, then you have something like Super Meat Boy or Teleglitch - very hard, but it always feels like it's you who messed up.

The Butcher gets the basics right but then gets so many details wrong that it's really hard for me to recommend it despite it dripping with style and good core gameplay.

For one, the screen is very hard to read - not only in terms of seeing enemies at all (or differentiating the player from enemies or differentiating enemy types), but also in terms of which parts of the level geometry will pass through shots and which won't. In this game this is absolutely crucial and the game stumbles heavily here. Enemies will instantly snipe you from the other end of the screen through what you maybe previously only saw as an impassible wall. Enemies will not only scream when they die, but also when they're just hurt, and in hectic situations (90% of the game) a lot of the time you simply don't get that needed kill confirmation either through graphics or audio so you can move your aim elsewhere. You waste precious miliseconds trying to figure out whether you got the kill or not.

Then there's all these other little design flaws: With the shotgun, you have to click repeatedly to fire. With the assault rifle you don't. So when the latter runs out of ammo and you get switched to the shotgun, suddenly you have to remind yourself to start clicking. Often you forget, so you die. Levels after the beginning chapter are about 30-40% longer than they should be - restarting will increasingly feel like a chore as you move through all the sections to get to the one where you died. The game will also repeatedly spawn enemies in waves to artificially pad the levels.

It's a shame as it could be a fantastic game but these really basic game design problems ruin the enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031149508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1535638547}
review:
A bucket full of "Just one more try" (and pixelated blood).

Butcher is tough: part-shooter, part puzzle, part platformer, but almost everything can be memorized or figured out through trial and error. So while being pretty hard at first, a bit of perserverance has (so far) got me through on "hard".  On the surface it may seem like another "Super meat-boy/N++" type game but it isn't. Success relies more on knowing what spawns where, and which weapons to use, and having a bit of hand-eye, rather than needing inhuman reflexes and perfect timing.  Put another way: I hate those other games, and I like this.

If there is something to complain about it would be the overly pixelated art-style.  It is minimalistic, but sometimes things are a little *too* pixelated for its own good (espcially your character), to the point of making details hard to decipher.  It's a small complaint though: the game is fun, can be had cheap, and is the kind of thing that will make you late for work as you keep replaying the same level trying to reach the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972179572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1527490382}
review:
Butcher is an easy game to review.

You play as a Terminator-esque death machine tasked with killing humans. It plays somewhat like a 2D version of DOOM: you have the firepower, but they have the numbers, and you'll need to keep moving to avoid death. Levels are quick and satisfying, and brutalizing humans with shotguns and flamethrowers and buzzsaws never gets old. It has a great look and an even better soundtrack.

That's really about it. Butcher is a game best enjoyed by measured expectations. Don't expect a story or a twist that changes up gameplay. It's short. It knows exactly the game that it wants to be. If you jive with that then you'll love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039687915', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1526336381}
review:
Good game that needed just a bit of polish to be a great one. Audio is definitely its strong point ; the gameplay is kinda repetitive but nervous, with just the right amount of strategy ; graphics are neat but the characters are a blur and it's hard to see where you at at some point. 

Finished the game in hard under 4 hours, so it's not really worth grabbing unless you really click with the gameplay. Make sure to grab it on sale though !

author: {'steamid': '76561197967817775', 'num_games_owned': 2072, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1597887782}
review: Surprised this hasn't gotten more love, it's a solid 2-D Quake-esque blast 'em up that can run on (almost) anything with an appropriately grungy soundtrack to back it up. The story's non-existent and there's definitely an element of trial and error to beating the levels, but with a successful run often being measured in a few minutes it's hard to get too upset. Not for the squeamish, but anyone interested in a fairly tough throwback shooter should give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005559933', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1525524763}
review:
This game was an intense blast. Its tough but fair. I found moving constantly helped my survival. If i tried to camp an area i died quickly. The final level before the last boss was by far the toughest for me. To beat the final  boss, i didn't even bother to  change weapons after a few tries i just went through them until they ran out of ammo and concentrated on kiting it and its attacks :-)

The flamethrower is a great weapon but burning youself to death just before completing a stage is annoying so use it with a little caution :-)

I played the game from start to finish with an Xbox360 gamepad. It worked perfectly from the moment i first booted the game up. I guess you lose some accuracy from not having the mouse but i found it didn't hinder me much really.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197982306173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1524954142}
review:
BUTCHER has a lot of potential but ultimately falls flat due to a single critical flaw: No weapon bindings.

No weapon bindings means that you have to scroll through all your guns to get to the one you really want. Seems like a very minor thing, until you realize you have to shift focus away from everything important and look at the tiny text show briefly in the middle of the screen and switch from one gun to the next until you get the one you want. Meanwhile, enemies keep blasting you while you are defenseless to do anything. Since BUTCHER is a very fast and unforgiving game you are punished severely for this. It's not obvious at first, but quickly becomes a huge issue as your arsenal grows. It makes the game tedious to play and I no longer enjoy it as I feel my inability to beat certain encounters is due to the lack of control offered by the game rather than my reflexes.
developer_response: Good news! You can set up the weapon bindings for the keyboard in the settings: Settings > Controls > Weapon keys. By default, it's 1 to 6 for all weapon slots, but it's fully customizable.

review: I like Butcher. It's a simple, level-based platformer where your main goal is to turn things that are alive into things that are not-so-alive anymore. Levels are fast paced and centered around memorization and reflex, the musical score is pretty dark and grimy, and shooting dudes until they explode into chunks is fun and satisfying.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198053391940', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1524433455}
review:
Lorsque je lis les évaluations anglaises contenant les mots "fair" ou "non frustrating", je m'imagine les personnes qui vont nager dans une eau à 10° et qui ressortent en disant, entre deux claquements de dents : "elle était bonne !".

Non, elle est pas bonne du tout.

Butcher n'est pas un bon jeu en soi.

Les environnements sont très réussis, mais les sprites sont trop petits et ternes pour être suffisamment visibles -> augmentation injuste de la difficulté.

Il faut gérer le saut ( et la "descente" d'une plateforme ) avec une seule main ( l'autre étant sur la souris ), c'est laborieux et conduit à de nombreuses erreurs et imprécisions -> augmentation injuste de la difficulté.

La difficulté est mal gérée entre les niveaux, et parfois les pièges sont pires que les adversaires au lieu de n'être qu'un élément de difficulté supplémentaire.

Le sound-design est très très bon ( mais pas extraordinaire, il n'y a là rien de fondamentalement novateur ).

La DA est également très bonne ( mais également vue et revue. Ce qui lui empêche d'être "exceptionnelle" ).

Le DLC W.I.M.P. est une vaste blague. Au lieu de proposer un mode normal, il propose un mode "ultra facile" ( sauf pour les pièges qui continuent de one-shoter de manière particulièrement perverses dans certains cas, ce qui créé des situations assez surréalistes en terme de game-design ).

Bref voilà un jeu très difficile pour de mauvaises raisons qui propose un mode ultra-facile qui apparaît comme un "gros fuck" aux joueurs considérés comme "casuals".

J'appelle ça du mépris pour le joueur, à quasiment tous les niveaux.

P.S. : j'ai oublier de dire que le nombre de niveaux était ridiculement petit, et que ces derniers étaient ridiculement court. Bref, en ligne droite ça doit frôler les 1H de jeu à tout casser. On comprends les choix de game-design ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198062048833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1570682624}
review: Beyond a couple levels it isn't that difficult but still fun, blood is persistent between tries in a session so if a particular level is difficult you'll know it by how saturated the floors are. Grenade launcher and flamethrower are next to useless as you're just as likely to hurt yourself (or miss entirely) as you are the people shooting at you and kind of fail at being boss killers as the assualt rifle will take them out faster with the only drawback being you running low on ammo but its ok because your shotgun is your workhorse mobkiller. Ammo is persistent between levels, health returns to 100 out of 200 and your armor drops to zero. Don't waste ammo on the unarmed dudes, the 5 health isn't worth the bullet when you have ninjas bonzai rushing you or at all really. Just herd them to the corner and chainsaw, thats the only time you will use it as it is also basically worthless even against the basic fodder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007866241', 'num_games_owned': 3862, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1523758368}
review:
[code]Hey! If you enjoy short and sweet reviews, follow my curator page [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/29273632-El-Rincón-de-Cooper]here![/url] I am an independent Curator providing reviews and insights to the games that need the spotlight! Thank you! :) [/code] 

Remember that time when you were a sweet, innocent kid and your uncle said to you: 
"Hey, kid. Wanna play THE JUNGLE game? WE are the animals. And as you know animals don't wear clothes...¨

Well. This game is harder than that.

AMAZING game. Hands down, one of the best 2D shooters that money can buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993233356', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1572395315}
review: Tough twitch-heavy little 2D Quake game. I dislike the unfair teleporting of enemies right at your face, preferably at the end of the level without any chance of surviving, just so you know to watch out for them the next time you get to that part of the level. It takes a few trial and error retries for each level until you master it enough to finish it, but it's fun enough to love playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176675135', 'num_games_owned': 3350, 'num_reviews': 2843, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1520257978}
review:
[h1]向日葵游戏评分：6分（1-10）[/h1]
美式像素横版射击游戏。
这是一款快节奏的2D射击游戏，像DOOM和Quake一样，典型的美式暴力风格，伴随着吵杂的重金属音乐将敌人轰个粉碎吧！游戏由一个个小关卡组成，战斗中不仅仅需要躲避敌人的子弹，还需要逃离各种机关，玩家可随时切换武器，当护盾和血条消耗完毕即游戏失败。当前版本增加了新手难度，动作游戏苦手也不用害怕了。游戏虽然是像素风格，但画面过于粗犷，还达不到FC的水准，特别是人物根本看不清。
[h1]欢迎大家关注我们的鉴赏家：https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28763059[/h1]
[h1]关注微信公众号和头条号“向日葵游戏”获取更多资讯；官方微博：向日葵游戏评测[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197996285496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1706634840}
review:
I see a lot of DOOM/Quake/etc references getting thrown around, but y'know what this game reminds me of?

Contra, for people who grew up on Contra. Not quite bullet-hell, but that same frantic pace. Add in modern advances in game engines/graphics/etc, and this is a grown-up version of Contra.

Fuckin' love it. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197972878111', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1522056138}
review:
La grafica non è delle migliori, anzi.
Capisco il voler dar il senso del retrò ma è un pochino troppo...retrò!

Il gameplay è molto carino invece, meglio giocarlo che vederlo direi! 
Bello impegnativo,a volte un po' infame,però da soddisfazioni nel finir un livello.

Una pecca potrebbe esser l'assenza di checkpoint,alcuni livelli risultano frustranti...ma vabbè,dopotutto non sono eccessivamente lunghi quindi basta armarsi di un po' di pazienza.

Sto gioco mi fa tornar bambino da quanto ti incuriosisce nell'esplorare :v


https://youtu.be/PQgPGMrQ__A

author: {'steamid': '76561198126092481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1486433672}
review:
I first played this game on my pc but using family share with my brother first time playing I died a lot didn't get exactly upset or mad just frustrated hahah but that's what kept me playing. This game is difficult just like some of the classics like Mega-man or Ghouls'n Ghosts. The game is just stunning, gory, bloody, music is fantastice, and gameplay is just so smooth for a 2d pixel game sure I wasn't "expecting," much but getting into it I fell inlove with this game! It reminded me of DOOM but 2d and it has a terminator style to it that is just wicked!
   I totally recommend this game to anyone!

author: {'steamid': '76561198247868226', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1567174359}
review:
oh my fxxking god does this game look like garbage,I can understand retro graphics  but in this game your character is literally made up by pixels you can count with your ten fingers,color pallette is limited and generally makes my eye hurt.gameplaywise it's really the samething over and over again,because you die a lot and judging from the six~seven levels I played it's basically unchanged,horribly designed levels,spamming enemy everywhere,you just shoot shit while listening to a sound track consisted of firecraker noise being played very fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999302739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1519893757}
review:
I went ahead and bought it on sale because I wanted to see if I could still enjoy it, despite the "Difficult" tag. Would I recommend it for whom it is meant to cater to? Yes. Would I recommend it for someone like me? No, this game is a waste of money, in that case.

If you just want a bloody, gorey, fun little game you can play casually, steer waaaaayyyy clear. The easiest difficulty without the ridiculous dlc, Hard, feels perfect until you get to certain points in the game, wherein they are just a bit too difficult for me to keep my steam going. It becomes that type of game where I get stuck in one part, occasionally boot up the game to try once again, die again, shut down the game for lack of motivation, then repeat.

Worst part honestly is they tease the hell out of gamers like me with a dlc that offers "easier" gameplay. You quickly find out the dlc is just full of shit, it's basically a joke. With the W.I.M.P. dlc, you go from the easiest difficulty being just a wee bit too hard to enjoy to "well now I can just spray bullets and win." It's just a cruel joke lol.

If you love difficult little platformers that are full of blood and gore, it's great. Otherwise, don't give it the benefit of the doubt when it's tagged "Difficult."

author: {'steamid': '76561197993473791', 'num_games_owned': 1541, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1519454331}
review:
キーボード&マウスを使用。 

[u]ゴアな表現が強い2Dシューティングアクション。あらゆる武器を使用して、殺戮のかぎりを尽くせ。日本語化はできないものの、ストーリーはほぼ皆無なので問題ない。[/u]

[h1][b]【良い点】[/b][/h1]

◆ 不気味だが良く表現されたドット絵、ゲームの雰囲気にマッチしたBGM。どれも良い出来になっている。

◆ 必要数十分な武器種。各武器共に使い勝手が良く、バランスも取れている。一つの武器のみを使用しているとすぐに弾薬が尽きてしまうので使い分けていくのも重要になってくる。

◆ アクションが爽快。操作はいたってシンプルで「移動（跳ぶ）、撃つ（たまに切る）、武器を切り替える」。酷い言い方だが、敵を倒した時の効果音等も良い感じだ。

◆ 全体的に難易度は高めだが、一様難易度は選択可能になっている。「Hard」 「Harder」「Hardest」「Impossible」と気の利いた難易度表記になっている。

◆ 1ステージは比較的短く、サクッとプレイできる。死に覚えも重要になってくるゲームなので、やり直す際にストレスなく再度プレイできるだろう。

[h1][b]【悪い点】[/b][/h1]

◆ 良くも悪くも死に覚え系なので苦手な方はご注意を。

◆ 全体的に敵の位置を特定し辛い。綺麗なドット絵が災いし、背景と重なってしまう場合も。

[h1][b]【総評】[/b][/h1]

オールドライクな横スク2Dシューティング&高めの難易度でゴア表現も強く、少し人を選ぶ作品になっている。だが、上記した通りアクションは爽快でやりごたえも抜群なゲームになっているので個人的にはオススメの作品。

プレイ動画をアップしているので、気になった方は[u][url=https://youtu.be/SBQY4A-tbss]こちら[/url][/u]を参考までにどうぞ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198084280744', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1518780932}
review:
BUTCHER strikes the same nerve as Doom and Quake with the difference of it being a 2D platform shooter. Contrary to expectation, it's not too difficult to beat the game on "Hard", though higher difficulties and the option to do dedicated speedruns offer plenty of additional challenge.

The beautifully animated, gritty pixel art and the pumping but not overwhelming industrial soundtrack fit together perfectly. The whole visual and auditory design is excellent with the exception of some screams becoming slightly repetitive over time. Most importantly the shotgun sound is spot on.

The controls are conventional and quick to grasp. Overall the game doesn't need a lot of explanation regarding story or gameplay. The character movement however feels slow at times because of some finicky vertical platforming controls. Especially the standard gamepad button layouts, namely the melee attack and the sideways to down left stick movement transition, are unoptimised. Adjusting some keys is possible but it still seems the game was made primarily with keyboard and mouse in mind.

BUTCHER is pixel gore galore with all the hardcore vibes that please a player's blood frenzy. Only interrupted by a few annoying control issues, it overall feels satisfying and fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985450575', 'num_games_owned': 1197, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1587069624}
review:
To jedna z tych niepozornych gier, które wyciskają z Ciebie wszystkie emocje. Szybka, trudna, krwawa, pikselowa wersja Quake w 2D. To się musi podobać. 

Grafika jest mistrzostwem świata. Za pomocą pikseli, grafiki 2D i poziomów wziętych żywcem z platformówek udało stworzyć mroczny świat fabryk, podziemi, innych planet. Odpowiednio dobrane kolory pomagają przypomnieć sobie stare czasy Dooma i Quake. Znów jesteśmy w tamtych grach. 

Tym razem sterujemy jednak bohaterem złożonym z kilku pikseli. Atakować będą go rożni wrogowie co wymaga stosowania nie tylko różnych broni, ale także taktyk. Jeśli wspominam oręż to mamy tu cały arsenał. Od klasycznej piły łańcuchowej (!), przez wspaniałego shoguna, aż po railgun. 

Wprawdzie nie wiem czy tak brzmi railgun w rzeczywistości, ale za to jak on brzmi. Jakby niebo rozdzierała błyskawica. 

Dodam przy okazji, że nie tylko arsenał śmierci, ale także system obrażeń jest dopracowany.  O przyjęciu na klatę strzału z shotguna i przeżyciu nie ma raczej mowy. Z drugiej strony możemy tak szczęśliwie skoczyć i zrobić unik, że zostaniemy tylko lekko zadraśnięci. Granatnik ma z kolei swoją balistykę. Jest więc dobrze. 

Sama rozgrywka jest bardzo szybka, choć znajdziemy momenty kiedy możemy na kilka sekund wyciszyć emocje przed następną walką. Na każdy etap mamy jedno życie co wymaga od nas przejścia żywcem każdego poziomu. Umierać będziemy często, do momentu gdy idealnie przebijemy się przez zagradzających nam drogę przeciwników. Po kilku próbach idziemy faktycznie jak Butcher.

Otaczające nas środowisko jest częściowo zniszczalne. Tak więc w powietrzu mogą fruwać nie tylko części ciał przeciwników, krew, odłamki wybuchów, ale także skrzynek czy drzwi. Jeśli dodamy do tego płomienie, wystrzały to na ekranie mamy czasem słodki chaos. Przyznam, że miałem momenty kiedy nie wiedziałem czy jeszcze żyję czy już nie, co się dzieje na ekranie, gdzie jestem i co to za rzeźnickie dźwięki płyną ze słuchawek. 

Muzyka oczywiście idealnie pasuje do jatki, a jatka do muzyki. Bardzo dobre kompozycje. Jedyne do czego bym się przyczepił do pojawiające się jakby odgłosy płaczącego dziecka w czasie rzezi co mnie wkurzało. Poza tym ideał. 

Zgodnie z tytułem znajdziemy tu dużo świeżego mięsa dla wszystkich miłośników klasyki.  Trzeba zagrać.  

PS. Chętnie zagrałbym w dłuższą wersję z bardziej rozbudowaną fabułą.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989373871', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 298, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1638893184}
review: Hallo, es ist wirklich sehr schade, dass ich dieses ansich tolle Spiel negativ bewerten muss. Eine neutrale lässt Steam leider imer noch nicht zu. Das Spiel wird später ziemlich schwer und es fehlen einfach die Speicherpunkte (ja ich bin ein Weichei :-) Der Schwierigkeitsgrad fängt ja auch erst bei Hard an. (bin eigenlich Schooter-Freak und trainiert :-) Kenn jemand wenigstens ein paar funktionierende Cheats? Liebe  Hersteller, bitte mehr Speicherpunkte oder anpassbaren Schwierigkeitsgrad! Sonst colles Game, Danke. Werde auf positiv switchen, wenn sich was ändert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084912545', 'num_games_owned': 932, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1552933753}
review:
Me dejo la pija al palo por casi seis horas.
No, en serio. La frase "The easiest mode is HARD" es literal. Es muy frenetico, la IA responde muy bien, que es algo fundamental en juegos asi. Hay unos 21 niveles si no me equivoco y el 90% son cortitos, entre 3 y 7 minutos de duracion (sin contar las veces que vas a morir). El gore, las tripas y cortar a pedazos a los indefensos con la motosierra es algo sumamente placentero. En muchisimas partes vas a estar encerrado en una arena y van a aparecer enemigos de todas partes, ahi es cuando la cosa se pone linda. Hay que sobrevivir a los tiros, moverse por toda la arena para agarrar la municion que nos dejan y seguir matando, hasta que se termine.
Ademas de esto, hay un coleccionable que son calaveras, creo que 35. Estan bien ocultas, yo solo encontre 12 xD y te dan premios por juntarlas, se que a las 20 [spoiler]desbloqueas el modo imposible (el mas dificil, dah)[/spoiler] y al juntarlas todas [spoiler]te dan un logro, no se si algo in-game xD[/spoiler]. Tambien tiene un filtro como de tele (las lineas de color saturadas ligeramente) que le da cierto aspecto sucio al juego, y ayuda a toda la atmosfera que nos rodea.
Juego muy infravalorado, lo recomiendo ampliamente. Gracias por leer <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198088598107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1550121627}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197991845568', 'num_games_owned': 2241, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1515463492}
review:
This game is disappointing and I really, really hate to say it, because I wanted to love it and I couldn't wait to play it.

It looks awesome and bad at the same time. While in the first stages you won't notice it, in later stages the game preys on you not seeing enemies, because they blend perfectly with the backgrounds. Color pallete is rather stale and it kills any variety of envintorments. Soundtrack is pure greatness and it really fits. Game is incredibly violent and I love it, although it gets stale after a while and the game becomes tedious when you notice it has nothing to it, because stage design is rather non-existent, because it is arena 2D shooter and arenas look nearly identical.
When they try stage design, it sucks, because it's cheap and it only gets you, because you don't know what will come next.

Game is most of the time artifically hard and cheap, it rarely does offer a fair challenge. While in first 2 acts you won't notice that, because the game is fairly easy until you hit Jungle Outpost and the game starts going downhill from there, because you notice all of the flaws. Arenas are small, it will get really hard to avoid damage, especially from homing missles, when you are bombared by enemies from top to bottom. And since there is barely any AI to talk about, to make enemies a threat, they can shoot through walls sometimes.
Idea of difficulty in this game is "throw a lot of crap on the screen with no power ups with barely any room to move and avoid damage". It is almost like Dark Souls 2 in that regard, where the game is only hard, because there is too much crap on the screen.
There are 6 weapons in this game, but half of them are situational (chainsaw to gain health) and mostly useless (chainsaw, rail gun, flamethrower, grenade launcher), most of the time you will run with assault rifle and shotgun. Rest you will use rarely or try to avoid using them, because you will take damage that you will likely not avoid, because arena is too small. 
There is barely any content, 5 acts, 4 stages each, with one act being finale boss fight. Yes, there is one single boss fight in this game and you know what? It's actually one of the easiest parts of the game, because arena is huge, you have space to avoid damage (unlike cheap level ending chapter before this stage) while boss mostly flies around and attacks from time to time. You just whale away on him with grenade launcher and rail gun and he's dead. It is braindead and unimaginitive, boss is just a flying pile of junk, literally.

As for the ending, Terminator reference with a "twist". 
And to tell you the truth, it sums up this game perfectly. It is just a middle finger straight to your face.
Barely 3 hours and I'm left disappointed, because with more polish, it could've been great, but in the end of the day, it is a huge waste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093325346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1572781127}
review: This game is FUN! Haven't played such a great shooter for a while. I finished the last level and started the game right over again. It is simple and fast, don't expect anything elaborate. You just run and kill. And die. That's it. Difficulty can be brutal at times, but to me, that's part of the fun. You have to be pretty damn quick. I'd suggest a gamepad for this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095924054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1515301600}
review:
The game was fun for awhile but then got annoying frustrating. Soon as the difficulty ramped up, I started using the gamepad controller, which made things alot easier. The controller has aim assist so theres no need to worry about too much hitting your mark and running out of ammo. The downside of using the controller is that the fun disappears and using keyboard/mouse becomes nearly impossible to beat. I can't really recommend it since half way through the game I already felt bored and I just wanted to complete and be done with it.

Negative:
- A complex difficulty off the bat with some trial and error situation, which you couldn't forsee.
- Final Boss seems ridiculously unfair, I couldn't figure out a pattern to beat him other than luck.
- Short Game
- run out of ammo easily if your using the mouse
- too much mayhem                         
                                                                                                                                                                              
Positive:                                                                                                                                                                 
- atmosphere and environment                                                                                                                            
- five firearms to utilize, plus a chainsaw melee weapon                                                                                     
- alot of mayhem, which could be a nice eye candy to look at but makes it physcially difficult hard to focus

author: {'steamid': '76561198032591163', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1514367091}
review:
------------ENGLISH------------

Hard as heck. But if you are a pssy you can download a (free) DLC for easier difficulty.

Super Gory

Super fast paced

Lots of action

Lots of inspiration from DOOM

Ideal for pixel graphics lovers

Some secrets here and there

You can masturbate and C U M on the guts of your agonizing enemies to show dominance

If you are into speed running this game gives you a warm welcome

A bit short, but every hour felt like 2-3 hours.

8/10 Ideal for unloading your hate towards humanity itself

------------ESPAÑOL------------

Dificl desde el comienzo. Pero si sos un llorón podes descargar un DLC (gratis) para hacerlo más facil.

Super sangriento.

Super fast paced.

Mucha acción.

Mucha inspiracion del DOOM.

Ideal para amantes de gráficos de pixeles.

Un par de secretillos por aquí y por allá.

Podes ejacular en las tripas y cadaveres de tus enemigos.

Si estas en la onda speedrunner el juego te da la bienvenida.

Un poco corto, pero cada hora se sintieron como 2-3 horas.

8/10 Ideal para descargar tu odio hacia la humanidad misma.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069781492', 'num_games_owned': 1728, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1500413126}

review: Fantastic concept and art (music, sfx, and pixel graphics). The difficulty level is welcome, however the game could really use some dynamic elements and variation in the fights (more enemies would be good) instead of memorizing all the traps and spawns to add to replay value. Having user-created levels does help with this. Nonetheless, I recommend this game for anyone who's a fan of dark music & pixel graphics and/or intense shooters. If you liked Abuse you'll like this game :) If you enjoyed this game, Broforce and Crusader: No Remorse are worth a look.

review:
A difficult game that has tried to be a mixture of Soldat, Doom, Acuse... and other action games of the 90s.
It has a very dirty pixelart and gore. The weapons, sounds and screams are very good, in addition, the brutal music accompanies it very well.
But... the game, in my opinion, does not frustrate, but it ends up tiring you.
I would only recommend it with a good offer.

review:
Плюсы:
1) Атмосфера Doom.
2) Перестрелки, кровища, кишки и пр...

Минусы:
1) Графика слишком уж сильно пиксельная.
2) Сложная. Самый минимальный уровень сложности, это "Hard". Приходится мучиться, проходя один этап по сто раз.
3) Мало патронов и одно попадание противника - отнимает почти всё здоровье.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993442361', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1511734961}
review:
DOOM en 2D pixelisée. Excellent petit jeu d'action intense, le feeling des armes est très bon, ceux qui ont passé leurs soirées d'ados sur le mythique Soldat ne devraient pas être deçus. 

Durée de vie courte (~3h dans la difficulté Hard (qui correspond au mode le plus facile...) mais rejouabilité possible pour ceux qui veulent trouver tous les secrets ou speedruner le jeu (apparamment faisable en 1h30). Les amateurs de die&retry apprécieront, les fans d'infiltration passeront leur chemin. 

A noter qu'il y a le Steam Workshop pour tester les niveaux de la communauté, le jeu possédant un éditeur de niveaux.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972990074', 'num_games_owned': 3125, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1511718082}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010360684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1537475380}
review:
One thing's for sure, this is a memorable game. The gory mess depicted in faithful pixel art and the industrial soundtrack with its relentless beats gave me goosebumps.

The gameplay also delivers on everything you'd expect from a 2D shooter. The weapons are well-designed, and you need the full arsenal to get through the game. Enemies behave naturally. The exploration aspect is there in form of secrets. The speedrunning is there, and the extreme difficulty levels as well.

★★★★★★★★★☆

author: {'steamid': '76561197971387837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1511442317}
review:
Quite gory and very difficult, even in the easiest mode (hard). The level design is good but sometimes out of the screen enemies can see and shoot at us (but so can we), it can be frustrating. The checkpoint system is a bit old school: you die, you start the level over.

I do recommend the game as it feels good when I finally finish a level. I've died often but still haven't finished it, so I think it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960266455', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1509705027}
review:
Soldat作った人の新作

いいところ
・ゴア表現がしっかりあって横スクロールシューターとしてはまあ標準以上の出来
・質素なグラフィックゆえにmapや新敵などアップデートにわりと意欲的

わるいところ
・グラフィックのドットが小さすぎてまじで米粒、3分で目が痛くなるデザイン
・fast-pacedを標榜するわりにはすごくノッソリしたプレイフィール。
・開発者の態度がわりとヤバい。Switchで出せたのもあってかイキリオタクな感じでずっと「これをクリアできないゲーマーはハードコアじゃない」みたいなことを延々と言っててすごい。
(追記)公式discordサーバーでは、Steamに投稿された否定的なレビューを晒してみんなで叩くという近年稀に見る状況が見られるくらいほんとにすごいです

review:
Кровь, вонь разорваных тел, дымящийся ствол шотгана, циркулярки, крики пока ещё живых врагов и....мастурбирущий посреди всего этого перфоманса брутальный инопланетянин.

Ачивки доставляют.
Враги доставляют.
Геймплей доставляет.
Даже финал и босс доставляют.
Внатуре - этакое внебрачное дитё ДУМа и Кваки.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963197238', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1513000808}
review: Brutally relentless and unapologetically difficult. A lot of games fail to be both fun and hard but this one has mastered both. It isn't so annoying having to start the levels from the beginning because it's extremely fun blitzing through the same area again and again, and the satisfaction is overwhelming when you master a level. I hope this sells well, it deserves it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119401657', 'num_games_owned': 2238, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 1471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1471, 'last_played': 1507007132}
review:
[ 직관적이고 재밌는 2D 플랫포머 게임 ]

단순하면서도 지루하지 않다
스토리가 없기 때문에 자칫 지루할 수 있는 게임을 다양한 맵 구성과 하드코어한 난이도로 커버함

적을 쏴죽이며 목표지점까지 가야하는 전형적인 스테이지형 게임이지만, 
다양한 총기와 고전느낌이나는 픽셀 그래픽, 고어함으로 단순함의 재미를 맛깔나게 살린 수작
 
숨겨진 요소들도 꽤 있고, 도전과제의 밸런스도 상당히 괜찮음. 

취향은 탈 것 같으니 도트+플랫포머+어려움을 고려하여 구매하시길 추천합니다 !

author: {'steamid': '76561198332154626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1638546880}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012248494', 'num_games_owned': 4828, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1505924190}
review:
하드코어한 슈팅 플랫포머 버쳐 입니다.

일단 플레이하면서 많은 분들이 말씀하신 것처럼

분위기가 둠과 상당히 유사했습니다.

게임의 배경뿐만 아니라

적이 죽으면서 내뱉는 신음소리같은 사운드 분위기,

그리고 HP와 방어 아이템의 시스템등 말이죠.

플레이 타임은 3-4시간 정도 걸렸습니다.

특별히 단점은 없었는데 기본이 하드모드 이기때문에

난이도가 높아 

스트레스를 받을 각오를 하시고 플레이 하셔야 합니다.

특히 마지막 스테이지와 보스 부분에서

이 겜의 플레이 타임  3분의 1의 시간을 다 쓴 것 같습니다.

패드로는 보스잡기가 상당히 힘들기 때문에 

보스 부분에서는 키보드와 마우스를 추천합니다.

------------------------------------------------

정말 하드코어하고 난이도가 높은 슈팅 플랫포머를

찾으신분들께는 추천드리고 싶습니다만

author: {'steamid': '76561197970990703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1591913162}
review: If you like gory, dark, 16-bit style action games, then this is definitely something for you. It plays like a mix of hotline miami and contra. However - I needed to try several (xbox) gamepad configurations till it felt right. Here is my final setting: jump: LT, fire: RT, prev weapon: LB, next weapon: RB, activate: press right stick. Try it out if you lose to much time between your actions -  especially in the later "extermination" sequences. Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010560368', 'num_games_owned': 1183, 'num_reviews': 703, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1507474567}
review:
[h1]BUTCHER[/h1]
[i]The easiest mode is “hard”[/i]

Эпиграф говорит сам за себя - игра невероятно хардкорна. Именно этот факт притягивает и одновременно отпугивает от игры. Каждый уровень требует чуть ли не запоминания позиций всех врагов и оттачивания движений по карте. Залипнув хотя бы на секунду, можно потерять все твое здоровье. Очевидно, что сложность - изюминка игры, хардкорные геймеры будут довольны, но лично я, после часа попыток пройти один единственный уровень сдался и забил на игру. Что касается графики - она довольна специфична, сильный закос под пиксельную графику 90ых. 
Хардкорным геймерам рекомендуется, остальным может показаться слишком сложной.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057218732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1501965553}
review:
[h1] DOOM, Bro Force, Serious Sam (e anche Terminator, perchè no!)...	[/h1]

...E molti, moltissimi altri giochi sono stati di ispirazione per questo pixellosissimo sparatutto in due dimensioni chiamato [i] BUTCHER	[/i]. Preso con un bundle, questo divertente giochetto mi ha intrattenuto discretamente bene, con fasi di shooting divertenti ma, a tratti, assai confusionarie e caotiche, causando dipartite su dipartite: considerate poi che [i] BUTCHER	[/i] esordisce nel menù principale con la frase "the easiest difficulty is hard" e quindi non aspettatevi un gioco particolarmente semplice, anzi! La difficoltà base è comunque ben calibrata, con un graduale aumento della sfida generale fino ad arrivare al bizzarro e frenetico scontro finale (cinefili e non, riceverete una piacevole sorpresa non appena arriverete ai titoli di coda...!). Le armi sono poche, partendo dalla classica motosega, passando per shotgun e fucili d'assalto per poi arrivare ai pesanti lanciafiamme, lanciagranate e per finire la devastante railgun, arsenale che andrà a falciare orde di nemici di varie tipologie, dai più classici soldati fino ad arrivare a automi muniti di lanciamissili o robot con una enorme motosega rotante. Il livello di sfida e le varie difficolità potrebbero aumentarne la longevità, ma non aspettatevi un titolo lungo, perchè ne rimarrete assai delusi. Tutto sommato però, [i] BUTCHER	[/i] è un'esperienza positiva e tutto sommato divertente...Promosso!

review:
This game is very challenging, and very fun. It is divided into different stages, where you must get from point A to point B. Very simple. The fun lies in the challenge. The graphics are very old school pixel graphics, where you can see the individual pixels. There is no zoom option, unfortunately, although I can understand why they didn't do that. 

The blood and gore are well done, and not overly gross. It's worth the price tag, but it's definitely nothing ground breaking. Fun for a quick 15-30 minute break.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066983814', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1585428775}
review:
A short and difficult 2-D shooter. Think of it as a single player Broforce but with more blood, screaming and brutality. The soundtrack gets the blood pumpin in those tense moments when you only have a few bullets left and are close to death. If you like Quake and/or Doom, you'll feel right at home here.
Now with the new Level editor, the community can keep making new content for the game. This game is worth it, trust me. I only with more people would learn the level editor and make more levels or that the level editor had a built in totorial for new comers. Look up in the disscussions page and you'll find a pinned message from the devs linking you to a video totorial.
Bloody good fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034306697', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 617, 'playtime_forever': 1495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1495, 'last_played': 1500293282}
review:
[b]A short but difficult, very-bloody 2D shooter.[/b]

All in-game commands are rebindable for both KB+M and a controller. If you get the hang of using a controller, the game actually becomes a bit easier due to the built-in auto-lock feature that turns on when you aim at an enemy's general direction. On KB+M, your aiming has to be more precise and it's even harder when most enemies are small on the screen. Both ways are very playable and just becomes a matter of preference on how it should be played.

The pixel art is very detailed, minus the actual character models. The protagonist and the enemies (save for the one boss in the game) are extremely small on-screen and have very little detail on them compared to the rest of the game's graphics. They're so small and lacking in detail that they can sometimes be hard to spot amidst the chaos and environment.

The sounds & music in the game are great. The music accentuates the overall theme of fast murdering and the sounds are pretty detailed from the various enemy screams to the weapons that actually sound like they have impact to them.

There's hardly a plot in the game. According to the Steam Store Page, you're a cyborg sent to purge what's left of humanity. Simple.

Concept of the game's also simple, go from point A to point B to beat the level. There are 24 levels in total; 3 for demo/tutorial, 4 each for 5 areas, and 1 boss level. Most levels have you traversing whole paths while some just have you stay in one large area fighting waves of telegraphically spawned enemies until the game tells you you can proceed. Each level takes around 3-4 minutes on average to finish, but that's if you succeed. There are no checkpoints either, meaning that death results in starting the current level from the beginning. Enemy spawns and traps are always cued in some way but dealing with them still requires some skill.
The game's also designed for speedrunning thanks to the hidden movement mechanics like grenade jumping and bunny hopping. Some secret collectibles can only be obtained through these methods anyway.

You're given a lot of control over your character's movement. You can cancel jumps for a fast drop, bunnyhop, shotgun-boost, and so on. All this at your disposal for a variety of reasons but that's if you know how to even use them properly.

It's easy to die against anything here. Enemies however, telegraph their attacks with an exclamation mark on their heads that indicate they've spotted you and are about to attack, even the ones that are slightly off-screen. You always have enough time to avoid their incoming fire via strafing or jumping out of the way in case you can't fire at them for whatever reason. If you manage to land a bullet, kick, or chainsaw hit in on a common enemy, they get stunned for a second or two. If you're out of their vision for a while, they go back to "patrolling". All that said, there's usually a hefty amount of enemies surrounding you with attacks anyway, making the game as tough as it is with the enemy mechanics being one of the things that balances out the difficulty.

There are only six weapons throughout the entire game and they're all useful and feel powerful. The chainsaw though is useless for the most part but for anyone who really knows when to make use of it, it can save ammo when needed. Ammo pick-ups aren't too scarce but you can only carry so much of it that you've still got to make as many shots count as possible.

The game likes to advertise itself on how difficult it is. There are three difficulty settings available from the start, Hard, Harder, and Hardest. The "easiest" difficulty mode is "Hard" unless you download the free "EASY MODE" DLC. If you collect enough of the secret collectibles, you unlock the last difficulty option, Impossible. The change from Hard to Harder is that you have less health. The change from Harder to Hardest is that you can no longer find health and armor. And Hardest to Impossible has you have even less health. Other than those, the rest of the game is the same regardless of the difficulty setting.
While I like the challenge in the game, I don't find that it gets much more fun the higher the difficulty you go. Because of the decrease in health and lack of health/armor, you've got to be more cautious and take the game more slowly. The music and overall tone of the game wants you to run & kill fast but the higher difficulty strongly discourages that. On Impossible difficulty, you're pretty much dead in just a few hits, telling you to take it even slower. The challenge is there but it strays from the pacing.

A basic playthrough for a decent enough player may take 3-5 hours to beat. It's not a long game and the replayability isn't too large either, though it's there for those who just want a challenge. There's a level creation system with some new features that aren't in the base game for some reason. It's not very simple to use and there aren't a whole lot of user created levels on the Workshop right now.
The levels are fairly designed, the sounds & music are excellent, the graphics are great minus the character models, and it's as bloody & difficult as advertised.

author: {'steamid': '76561198291656516', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1530839113}
review:
I love this game.

Pros:

Music
Sound FX
Controls
Level Design
Visuals
Challenge
Weapons
Violence

Cons:

None

Difficulty:
I was on the fence about getting Butcher since I was concerned it might be too difficult. Butcher is very challenging and it is a very hard game. But, it's hard in a way that keeps you coming back for more. You have to think about how you can improve your strategy and react to enemy behavior. The game draws you back in after you take a break to regroup or calm your nerves from an intense session. Conquering a level feels like an accomplishment and pushes you on to continue fighting your way through stages. The lowest difficulty setting for Butcher is hard. I realized after beating it that there is DLC that unlocks a casual difficulty setting. I'd suggest attempting it with everything you have on hard mode. If you reach your wit's end and feel like throwing in the towel, give casual mode a whirl so that you can experience all of the levels and complete the game. Trust me, it's worth it either way.

Similarities:
I'm a huge fan of Broforce. Butcher is similar to Broforce with its 2d pixelated graphics. Butcher allows for you to shoot diagnonally, whereas Broforce only lets you shoot directly in front of you. Broforce tends to focus more on comedy. Butcher is more intense and violent.

Checkpoints:
Butcher does not have checkpoints. The game is designed for the player to survive a level in its entirety. At first this might seem off-putting or frustrating. But, part of the joy of the game is learning to manage your ammo and utilizing appropriate weapons for different types of enemies. Completing a level wouldn't be as rewarding if you could just inch your way through it with checkpoints.

Controls:
The controls in this game are smooth and responsive. This is good, because you must react quickly to enemies and move fast when pinned down. I used a PS4 controller and I recommend using a controller over a mouse/keyboard if you can. At times, your thumbs can get a bit sore from riding the analog sticks while aiming during intense battles. This is usually a sign that you need to take a break from the game and regroup.

Music:
Besides the menu music which I wasn't that fond of, I absolutely loved the soundtrack for this game. It's textbook industrial with thumping beats and dark synthesizers. It really sets the mood and none of the stage music grated on me during repeated attempts at finishing levels. For the final boss battle, I tried turning off the music. Not because I didn't like it, but because I was trying to calm my nerves from the intensity of the music. It ended up helping a bit and I was able to calm down enough to focus on my attack strategy.

Weapons:
The weapons are awesome in this game. You get a chainsaw, shotgun, assault rifle, flamethrower, grenade launcher, and rail gun. You become intimately familiar with how each weapon works and what kind of damage you can inflict on enemies. When you equip the rail gun, be sure and note that you can hold the fire button to charge the weapon for a more devastating blast. I was not initially aware that you could do this and I was firing it without a charge. This made some stages insanely difficult for me. I managed to make it through them after several tries and a lot of cursing, but it would have been so much easier had I known how to charge it.

Levels:
Each set of stages has a certain theme. You start off in an industrial complex, invade a military base, explore a jungle outpost, infiltrate a research lab in a volcano, and fight your way through a futuristic city that reminded me of Blade Runner. Most stages are linear and allow for exploration and platforming, but certain sections have arenas where you get locked in and have to fight enemies that appear out of thin air. The arenas are some of the most difficult aspects of the game, but these melees allow for you to hone your skills and dominate the sections that give you a little breathing room.

Character Size:
Your character is tiny. Even smaller than characters in Broforce. I would suggest playing this game on a big screen. I played the game on a projector displaying on an entire wall in my house. If you have a lot of screen real estate, you shouldn't have any trouble keeping tabs on your character and the intricacies of enemy movements. There's a lot going on in this game and you don't want to get lost squinting at pixels from across the room on a small screen. The game is also dark. This adds to the mood, but if you have too much contrast you might have trouble seeing the details of level environments.

Skulls:
Skulls seem to be hidden in walls and ceilings that seem completely out of reach. I scooped up a handful, but most I completely disregarded. Often times you are just trying to survive let alone worry about collecting extra goodies. I found myself hoarding ammo and health versus taking risks exploring levels for skulls. Maybe on subsequent play-throughs I'll take the time to try and hunt these down. But, for now, I was just relieved to survive the game on hard mode without rage quitting.

Tips:
As I said before, charge the rail gun. Take breaks from the game when you are overwhelmed. Take some time to think about your strategy and how you can improve. Part of the joy of this game is problem solving and self improvement. Find your rhythm. As you progress, your movements start to become more controlled and deliberate. Familiarize yourself with the capabilities of your weapons and use the best tool for the job. Conserve your ammo. Don't waste your bullets and try to focus on accurately aiming even when things get hectic. When you encounter characters without weapons, don't mow them over with the chainsaw if you have full health. Save them for later if you need a health boost. Take cover. Use the environment to your advantage and protect your character from taking damage out in the open. Don't give up! You can do this!

Conclusion:
I honestly love everything about this game. If you love games like Broforce and are up for a challenge, you will love Butcher. I wish there were more quality run and gun platformers out there. 1st person shooters give me motion sickness, so for me this is the next best thing. It truly feels like a side scrolling Doom game and the sound of all the weapons mixed with the industrial soundtrack is exhilarating. It's damn fun to play and cathartic. Do yourself a favor and buy this rollercoaster ride of a game. I really don't think you'll regret it. I didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009849888', 'num_games_owned': 1249, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1500097257}
review:
Remember when you were like 11-12 and you scoured the internet for freeware/abandonware/etcware games to play on your parent's aging computer, and you happened to stumble upon a classic like Abuse, Soldat, etc.?  This game is like that, when you found a completely free, fun, loud, gory action sidescrolling shooter game, and I mean that in the best way possible.  It has the polish of a modern indie game while retaining the barebones focus of a truly old school independent group of programmers.

Give it a shot, if you loved that era of freeware and such (Home of the Underdogs anyone) then you'll appreciate this just a little more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962717211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5061, 'last_played': 1639145112}
review:
OK here is my serious review on BUTCHER:

I always like when a game's store page matches the actual experience of the game. It's solid and polished and gives a consistend experience in sound and visuals.
 
Used to playing most games right on hard from the start I experienced that this game get's better the harder the game mode you choose/unlock - less damage resistance and no healh pick-ups force you to dodge and think ahead: hell yeah!

The further one plays into the game the more weapons you get and the harder and meaner the encounters become, making it everything than boring. I didn't feel forced into any boring repetetion during my playthroughs. 

Future content: well, there might be none (the dev just added 3 more levels geegee), but the workshop and editor has a lot of potential. The level editor of the game offers a lot of features not used in the campaign game at all like portals, safepoints and keycards. Without putting one line of code you can already make awesome, complex levels(!) cannot stress that enough!

The rest is a matter of taste.

[Got BUTCHER during it's last sale. After playing the first two levels I felt like a cheap fuck and gifted the game to a friend who started to become a bit strange buying games like witcher. I hope you can become a father now, buddy!

After so many unpolished fake-pixel-art-money-grab-games here is a real one, A real game. Real challenges, Play the Demo.]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970701643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1545489975}
review:
Butcher is like Doom + Broforce

I noticed one or two issues where an enemy could shoot me off screen, which, combined with their autolock can be somewhat frustrating. The game is at it's best when you are tranversing one area to another. When it sets up areas where you simply take on hoards of spawning enemies, it suddently becomes less interesting. And more a case of camping in a corner than running and gunning. Magically spawning enemies can be abit annoying as well, would rather solid placement. 

Overall, great game with a few minor blemishes. Cost me £3, and about 30-40 times better than an Ubisoft game, so take that for what it's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273043416', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4336, 'last_played': 1600414576}
review:
Yes, this game is hard.

If you can't deal with frustration I wouldn't recommend it.

If you enjoy a challenge, I strongly recommend it.


The game is a fast paced shooter with a story intended to instill mindless, mechanical slaughter of the human race. If you are looking for something inpirational that gently tugs at your heartstrings, this is not the game. It gives you a figurative and literal middle finger throughout the entire experience, and unless you are a platforming master or masochistic, you are not likely to play this long before getting stuck on a level for a few hours and quitting. I am neither, but I stayed because of the fine variation and very realistic graphics made at a very low resolution. Did I mention that it looks amazing?-
-And it feels even better when you're the one literally painting the town red (or white, if you're into that).


Again, don't buy the game if you get frustrated from a challenge, unless you are comfortable using the free WIMP-mode DLC; which I personally don't judge you for, but the game will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065135012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1602354676}
review: Doom Troopers в кубе. Огромный ржавый космический корабль скидывает маленький ржавый космический корабль на фоне какой-то горящей или распоротой до раскалёного ядра планеты-спутника, маленький корабль летит мимо какой-то здоровенной похожей на портал хуйни, висящей на орбите, по направлению к затянутой красными облаками планете, которая воняет так, какбудто её уже надо экстерминировать. Что это за корабли, за планета, какого хуя они тут забыли и что ждёт тех кто летит на них? Хуй знает, да и кому это надо. Ведь тут есть охуенный пиксельный графон с кровищей, кишками, враги тут КРИЧАТ ОТ БОЛИ, а ты такой в супержелезной броне с красными глазами ХУЯРИШЬ их из дробовика который СНОСИТ ИХ В КРОВАВОЕ МЕСИВО ОТРЫВАЯ КОНЕЧНОСТИ или из автомата который ЕБАШИТ БЛЯДЬ ГРОМКО И БЕЗЖАЛОСТНО. Тут блядь сталелитейные заводы с расплавленным металлом вместо лавы, потом подземелья с лавой, джунгли с шипами, пираньями и лавой, монументальные ржавые комплексы в вулкане и постапокалиптический одичавший город будущего с разваливающимися небоскрёбами, и самое главное КРАСНЫЕ ТОНА. Как если бы время застыло во времена первых приставок и до сих пор бы делали игры не сегу, но более хардкорные, динамичные и не привязанные к управлению старыми джойстиками. И саундтрек охуеннейший, держащий в напряжении, делающий половину мясных ощущений от игры, как и подобает хорошим саундтрекам.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980771676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 553, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1499545767}
review:
[h1]Wer sich Butcher nennt, ist selten ein Katzenvideogucker[/h1]

Sehr gut gemachtes Pixel-Run-and-Gun Game mit extra Gore. Spielt sich wirklich flott und jedes Ableben ist immer auf den eigenen Fehler zurückzuführen. Aber wenn man schon so Hardcore daher kommt, will man auch alles andere als Kindergarten sein - und deshalb heißt der niedrigste Schwierigkeitsgrad auch "Hard". Ein Spaziergang ist das nämlich auf gar keinen Fall. Und wenn ihr sterbt, dann fangt ihr schön am Levelanfang an. Zwar dauern die Levels nicht allzu lang, aber es ist immer ein bisschen schwierig einzuschätzen, ob man die nächste Passage zeitnah packt oder erst 200x beim Versuch drauf geht - es gibt bestimmte Arenen, die ich immer und immer wieder spielen musste. Meistens half eine gewisse Defensive, da die Gegner euch - egal in welche Richtung sie blicken - AUGENBLICKLICH erspähen, sobald ihr in ihrem möglichen Sichtfeld seid. Meistens warten sie noch eine Millisekunde ehe sie schießen - aber wenn sie treffen, tut's weh. Die meisten schießen auch gleich zwei Shotgunsalven auf euch, sodass Ruckizucki Ende im Gesundheitsbalkengelände ist.

Man muss diesen Befütterer der modernen langsam fast plattgetretenen Rogue-like-Welle echt mögen, um daran dauerhaft Spaß zu haben. Ich für meinen Teil bin absolut kein Fan von Redundanz und einen Level immer wieder von vorne anzufangen - da catchen mich nur wenige Spiele - wie bspw. Hotline Miami. Butcher ist mir in den meisten Fällen zu anstrengend und fitzelig was das Aiming auf Minipixel angeht.

🔫 Pew Pew Pew! 💥 Bock auf mehr Reviews? 🔎
🏃💨 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42792002/]Folge mir[/url] und verpass' keine weiteren Neuigkeiten! ⚡

author: {'steamid': '76561198021837454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1591437404}
review:
Straight from my nightmares to my PC!

Just when you thought they didn't make 'em like this anymore, with gratuitous violence, exploration, and borderline infuriating difficulty, along comes Transhuman design to jam Butcher into your back like a rusted meathook!

The sound design, and beautiful visceral soundtrack, combined with the visuals make for a very convincing and horrific atmosphere. You'll hear bifercated or impaled enmies cry out in genuine agony in dark, dingy metal hallways or see Jetpack guards burst into flames with the most spine chilling scream.

There is an "easy mode" DLC, but I think it violates the spirit of the game. Why would a cyborg, with the sole function of eradicating the final holdouts of the human race, explect it's job to be easy? "Oh hello human, may I exterminate you? No?"

author: {'steamid': '76561197987400749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1661690193}
review:
謎のお肉屋さんが戦うオールドライク風横スクロールSTG。
難易度はそこそこ、理不尽なようでそうでないというバランスなので理不尽さを期待してるとがっかりくる可能性あり。
というのもこのゲーム、よく死にますがコンティニューも無限なので昔のACTのように残機気にせず遊べます。
また死にまくりますが「死んで行動パターンを把握して、突破する」というデザインで造られてます。
なので敵の出現パターンや行動パターンさえうまく掴めば一見理不尽に見えるものでも気持ちがいいぐらいに上手く突破でき、それがこのゲームの醍醐味でしょう。
デザイン的には覚えゲーで、細かい動きを要求されるデザインですので結構疲れる構成になってたりします。
ただその分達成感は高く、高難易度「っぽい」デザインのゲームを遊びたいなら結構オススメです。

またこのゲーム、ゴア要素、銃を撃つ感覚の気持ちよさは結構よく出来てます。
効果音やエフェクトはドット絵ながら凝っていて、使ってて気持ちいいです。
雰囲気もどこかいい感じで、ストーリーは淡泊ながら色々妄想できるのもよかったと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561197973955071', 'num_games_owned': 4605, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1499101974}
review:
Si Doom ou Quake avaient été en 2D, ça aurait (littéralement) donné Butcher.

Tout nous rappelle ces franchises: les effets sonores, l'atmosphère, les armes, les ennemis, l'univers du jeu, bref, un hommage très réussit, au gameplay tout aussi rapide et amusant.
Difficile, mais jamais frustrant, puisque les niveaux sont courts et que si vous prenez du dommage, c'est généralement de votre faute. 10$ était déjà raisonnable, à 5,49$ dans la vente Steam, c'est un must.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202755292', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1510718564}
review:
[h1] BUTCHER [/h1]

This is a game that will/provide:
[*] BEAT YOU intO tHE FILThY SOIL
[*] Gore! GOre! gorE!!!

(Seriously, get in there and make some brutal levels and fuck shit up)

Awesome game, and why haven't you picked up this gory masterpiece of utter mayhem and metal??

author: {'steamid': '76561197967060366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1498398796}
review:
Pretty good shooter platform. This is what I imagine Doom and Quake would look and play like if they were released on SNES. Very challenging, think Super Meat Boy in terms of challenge and replayability. The super low fidelty pixel graphics do work against the game however, as it makes aiming and identifying enemies difficult.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198168574459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1664132584}
