author: {'steamid': '76561198014511270', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1475937468}
review:
WE CALLED THE NORMAL DIFFICULTY HARD
FUCK YOU MOM AND DAD

It's an overall well made game but I don't think it does anything particularly great beyond its presentation (the pixel art and music).  The gameplay is difficult, but in the "I'll just do this over and over until I learn where everything is/comes from" kinda way.  If you're looking for a cheap, retro, skill intensive game I would recommend Devil Daggers over this.  Brigador is another game to consider.  Still, it's cheap enough to not regret purchasing even if it is overall kinda ho-hum.  The IN YO FUCKIN' FACE HARDCORE VIOLENCE comes off not as annoying as Hatred but neither as fun as Strafe or as succesfully as the new DOOM.

7/10 it's okay.

Note:  When perusing through all the other seemingly overwhelming BEST GAME EVAR reviews please note the surprisingly large volume of people who seem to have received this for free.  I'm not sayin' anything specific, I'm just sayin'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017113307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1484443354}
review:
If there's one word that best describes Butcher, it's BRUTAL. The art, the sound, the music, the difficulty, the violence. All absolutely brutal. If you like Doom and/or Quake aesthetics you'll be right at home. Even though it's pixel art, the attention to detail is amazing. The pacing is great, you're rarely ever staying still. When you die, you seamlessly jump right back into it. I had a lot of fun playing Butcher and highly recommend it. Especially if you like fast paced twitch shooters and games like Soldat. 

You can watch my stream of Butcher here: https://www.twitch.tv/gnazghoul/v/93191056

author: {'steamid': '76561198013615277', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1475707682}
review: It was decent. I liked it, but it's nothing to go wild about. It's a simple game but is fun. Think about the difficulty of Dark Souls mixed in with the fast paced shooter of DOOM along with all of DOOM's gore and violence. The game kinda makes me think of Hotline Miami in a way. If you have extra money to spend, this is a game I'd recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996745546', 'num_games_owned': 1794, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1654422062}
review:
I've been following Michał & Co.'s work for over a decade now, beginning with their classic shooter Soldat and following up with games like King Arthur's Gold and Trench Run. 

Here's a few things I can tell you with absolute certainty: these folks love their tight gameplay and their relentless brutality. Several years ago Michał and Sigvatr (the man behind some controversial internet art) spent some time making a game called "Berserker", which was supposed to be the most violent thing ever, but something didn't work out and the project got canned. 

BUTCHER, I believe, is *the* ultraviolent game that Michał has been wanting to make all these years. It's dark, unforgiving and unrepentant. The gameplay is very no-buIIshit, and so tight that it hurts. Nothing is the game's fault - if you die, it's because you're not good enough. The graphics work really well, leaving just enough to the imagination and giving off a distinct DooM/Quake/Alien vibe. The gore is irreproachable, from the slurping of the shoes against a whole floor of dead humans to the way an entire enemy splatters with blood and pieces around the room due to a chainsaw stuck in their entrails. The soundtrack and sound design are very fitting and well-done, I will definitely be adding the music to my playlist. 

I recommend BUTCHER wholeheartedly. You might want to avoid it if: you don't like gore; you don't like a challenge; you don't like pixel graphics.

METAL AND FLESH

author: {'steamid': '76561197996731862', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1570620434}
review:
Waffen durchladen, Blut verteiln und frustresistent sein den ihr werdet Sterben und zwar oft.

Das ganze könnte man als eine Mischung aus Hotline Miami+ Quake+ Doom bezeichnen und das wars auch schon.

Man kämpft sich von Punkt A nach B mithilfe von verschiedenen Waffen die alle ziemlich wuchtig und gut klingen so wie die Hintergrundmusik.

Die Lvls erinnern mich persönlich sehr an das alte Quake, schmutzig und düster genau so sollte es sein, die hinzukommende Brutalität ist das Stück Doom und der Schwierigkeitsgrad Hotline Miami.

Wenn ihr damit was anfangen könnt kann man sich das ganze ruhig näher ansehn :)

ach, Steuerung ist entwas gewöhnungsbedürftig nach einpaar Minuten kommt man damit aber ganz gut klar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009457295', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1521156238}
review:
If you ever played Abuse back in the day, this is its spiritual successor or in better terms if Abuse and Doom had a violent baby that had chainsaws for hands and feet, and murdered the entire delivery room. Detailed points below video link.

https://youtu.be/eqpv392AVeY

Pros:
+ Unstoppable action, when you are in the zone you feel powerful and dangerous
+ Plenty of stuff to kill but damn they kill you right back.
+ Dark, sci-fi horror atmosphere.
+ Controls are tight, and percise, you fall or screw up its your fault.
+ Damn hard

Cons:
- Hard is the easiest difficulty, I happen to like this but it is not for the casual gamer.
- No checkpoints, so dying late in a level is a real ballache.
- Never enough ammo

author: {'steamid': '76561197985711851', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1538, 'last_played': 1559098794}
review:
No plot, tutorials, checkpoints or cutscenes. Rip and tear.

A fast skill-based sidescroller that gives you a proper challenge. The gameplay is fast and cut-throat: you kill most enemies in a single hit, but they will very likely return the favour shortly. The simple mechanics and tight controls yield a solid experience, and mastering your aiming and dodging will be crucial to clearing the tougher difficulties.

The game isn't terribly long, but the difficulty settings are very distinct challenges, and there are many creative secrets to find. The basic gameplay is satisfying enough to keep the game fresh for a good while.

The unique graphical style is pleasant to watch and the soundtrack complements the atmosphere excellently. As opposed to most pseudo-pixel games on the market, BUTCHER actually runs in 320x280 which is then scaled up. Effects make the combat look and feel great, altough sometimes the screen does get quite cluttered.

It's hard to come up with a reason to not pick a this well polished game up. If you think you can handle it, that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269053073', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1475630311}
review:
It hits the nail on the head when to call BUTCHER a blood-soaked love letter to games of the early 90s, most obviously DOOM. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wBBo7Z190RA 

From the portrait of your character withering away as you get shot and sliced, to the brutal violence, to the breakneck speed and action, BUTCHER is a 2D DOOM meets a metal Mario. You discover weapons, fight hoards of enemies, and you do it all through a blood-soaked lens. However, while the pixel art perfectly captures there era, sometimes the lack of detail can make it difficult to read the environment to tell if enemies you've shot are dead, and allowing for some frustrating traps and surprises to kill you. However, the stages are short enough that once you have a read on the level it's all manageable, making this a relatively minor annoyance. If you're a fan of DOOM and platformers, this game is worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057510520', 'num_games_owned': 1483, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1570610150}
review:
"Absolutamente frenético. Irremediablemente brutal. Innecesariamente animal" Así es como explicaría qué es este juego, un guiño "Dosdeado" de Doom dónde lo importante es salir con vida, no importa nada más. Solo tú y tu barra de vida. Avanzarás por terreno abrupto, aniquilando a tus enemigos en una vorágine de gritos y sangre. 

¿Qué si lo recomiendo? Me escuecen los ojos a rabiar, me he mordido un labio y tengo taquicardias. Me he empalmado con solo jugarlo..

9/10

PD: La psicóloga conmigo tendrá trabajo este fin de semana. Espero no llevar una sierra eléctrica.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979741653', 'num_games_owned': 1260, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1475608174}
review:
BUTCHER is a throwback to the nineties and more specifically Doom and Quake. The premise and atmosphere are similar, menus and music comprised. Difficulty as well.

BUTCHER is a 2D shooter, thus a platformer, and has to play differently than the aforementioned FPS games. Now think of a mix between Broforce and Hotline Miami. What we have here is a very intense game in which you pay dearly every mistake, as death forces you to restart a level. You sometimes need to know which enemies will come where, and prepare the right weapon to deal with them. The arsenal comprises shotgun, flamethrower and railgun. Every weapon has its use and feels great to use, from the damages tearing soldiers apart, to the screen that shakes to emphasize the violence of the shot.

For the most part the game mechanics are very old-school. No double jump, no dash or anything of the like. Instead the game makes up with very well crafted gunfights with two interesting details:


[list]
    [*]Simple platforms can be shot through. Which means that you have a lot of freedom of movement in maps that can be very vertical, while not having your aim blocked by all the platforms. Conversely, there are thicker platforms and walls that cannot be penetrated by bullets, and those can be effectively used as cover.

    [*]In a way that reminds of Metal Gear or Broforce, enemies that have seen the player and are ready to shoot have an exclamation mark on top of their head. This nice idea allows the player to quickly see enemies despite their dark figures, and to be ready for a shot coming from that direction. You will never feel that you got shot by a random enemy, you always know what’s coming.
[/list]

Effectively, the game is stripped down of anything related to chance, and the player has to brutally force their way through sheer skill. Aim and jump! 

Length-wise, it took me about 5-6 hours to finish the game without finding all the secrets. This might be a little bit short, however if it was a lot longer the game would risk feeling repetitive. 

At first I thought that the game was brutally difficult, quite keen to put a deadly trap at the end of an already difficult level after a series of deadly arenas. But then I learned to use the weapons better and predict the enemy shots, and never felt that the game was being unfair or too unbeatable.

Lastly, let’s discuss the art style. I know that some people reject it for its very minimalistic pixel-art approach. The soldiers almost look like they are out of the Command & Conquer strategy games! However, I find those graphics very evocative, with my imagination filling the blanks. If it was more detailed, it would feel a bit cartoonish. Overall it adds to the filthy, disturbing atmosphere, as if you were thrown in a futuristic but rusty meat grinder. It fits perfectly with the agonizing screams from the enemies that fell and are bleeding out.

In conclusion, BUTCHER is old-school to the bone, with a few additional features that make the game very relevant and enjoyable to play. A killer atmosphere and challenging gunfights make for a grisly offering to the gods of ultraviolence.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=775431925
